1######################################################################## 

2# almarenorm.py 

3# 

4# Script to calculate and optionally apply spectrally-resolved 

5# normalization correction for ALMA in the strong-line case. This is 

6# needed when Tsys measurements inadequately recover these lines 

7# either because Tsys is measured off-source (12m array and ACA) 

8# and/or at insufficient spectral resolution (12m array only). 

9# 

10# Usage (from CASA 5.x or CASA 6.1.1-15): 

11# 

12# (assumes this python file exists in the current working directory)  

13#  

14# sys.path.append(os.getcwd())  

15# from almarenorm import * # import  

16# RN=ACreNorm(<msname>) # create ACreNorm tool  

17# 

18### To examine Tsys spectra for spurious lines - BY EYE: 

19# 

20# RN.plotRelTsysSpectra(fthresh=0.01) - Luke's default 0.01 (1%)  

21# old default 0.002 is a very  

22# low trigger theshold 0.2% level 

23# 

24# this will also write a Tsys template file but it should always be checked 

25# as TDM (12m) Tsys are hard to fit and sometime diverage at edges suggesting 

26# to incorrectly flag a broad range of Tsys channel  

27# 

28# 

29### To evaluate the need for the correction on all FDM science spws  

30# and scans (excluding spws as specified), but making NO change in 

31# MS: 

32# 

33# RN.renormalize(createCalTable=False) 

34# 

35# (The renormalize function will nominally auto-detect all FDM and 

36# science scans to evaluate - without extra options runs default paramaters) 

37# 

38### To make plots (if hardcopy=True, unique names constructed from <msname> 

39# will be generated for each plot): 

40# 

41# RN.plotSpectra(hardcopy=True) # Scan-averaged Renorm spectra 

42# RN.plotSpwStats(hardcopy=True) # Scan/Ant-averaged peak stats 

43# RN.plotScanStats(hardcopy=True) # Scan-dep peak stats 

44# 

45## To apply the correction to fully-calibrated data (this scales the 

46# CORRECTED_DATA by default, applies the renormalization correction and writes 

47# it back (plot* commands can also be run after this): 

48# 

49# RN.renormalize(createCalTable=True) 

50#  

51## Close the ACreNorm tool (detaches from MS, etc.) 

52# 

53# RN.close() 

54# 

55######################################################################## 

56# 

57# Notes for future development - from some discussion with PLWG  

58# 

59# 

60# - PLWG might want some information to store in MS keywords 

61# 

62# 

63# - the plotSpwStats and plotScanStats coded by George I did not use  

64# very much - the way these stats are currently built is that 

65# they only pass the last field of a scan, i.e. the values are  

66# stored in the RN.rnstat dictionary which never had 'field'  

67# coded in. plotSpectra I have modified to do the correct  

68# cumulative average and takes all fields - even this could be  

69# split out into a per field basis 

70# 

71# 

72#########################################################################

104# Interface function for use by ALMA Pipeline renormalization task (PIPE-1687). 

105def alma_renorm(vis: str, spw: List[int], create_cal_table: bool, threshold: Union[None, float], excludechan: Dict, 

106 atm_auto_exclude: bool, bwthreshspw: Dict, caltable: str) -> tuple: ## PIPE-1469 for bwthreshspw 

107 """ 

108 Interface function for ALMA Pipeline: this runs the ALMA renormalization 

109 heuristic for input vis, and returns statistics and metadata required by 

110 the Pipeline renormalization task. 

111 

112 Args: 

113 vis: path to the measurement set to renormalize. 

114 spw: Spectral Window IDs to process. 

115 create_cal_table: save renorm corrections to a calibration table. 

116 threshold: the threshold above which the scaling must exceed for the 

117 renormalization correction to be applied. If set to None, then use 

118 a pre-defined threshold appropriate for the ALMA Band. 

119 excludechan: dictionary with keys set to SpW IDs (as string), and 

120 values set to channels to exclude for that SpW. 

121 correct_atm: this will get the transmission profiles for the SPW 

122 bandpass (or phase) and target(s) because the BP (or phase) and 

123 target(s) autocorr are compared in establishing the scaling in 

124 cases spectra, there can be issues where transmission is low and 

125 the source elevations are tens of degrees different. Often the ATM 

126 is not divided out well and leads to incorrect scaling in ATM 

127 regions. This option acts to fix this discrepancy so ATM are 

128 handled correctly. 

129 atm_auto_exclude: if True, then spectral regions found during the 

130 "check for false positives" algorithm will be excluded from the 

131 spectrum. 

132 bwthreshspw: disctionary with keys set to SpW IDs (as string),  

133 and values set to a bandwidth (in Hz) to use for dividing  

134 up the SpWs, e.g. 120e6  

135 caltable: Name of the caltable that renorm will create and write 

136 results to.  

137 

138 Returns: 8-tuple containing: 

139 - boolean declaring whether data are all TDM 

140 - ATM exclusion command 

141 - ATM warning 

142 - boolean declaring whether the renormalization correction was saved 

143 to a calibration table. 

144 - dictionary containing factors for Pipeline QA. 

145 - dictionary containing renormalization statistics indexed by source 

146 and SpW. 

147 """ 

148 # Initialize the renormalization object for input vis. 

149 print(' Doing the initialize in ALMARENORM itself\n') 

150 rn = ACreNorm(vis, caltable=caltable) 

151 

152 # Initialize return variables. 

153 stats = {} 

154 rnstats = {} 

155 atmWarning = {} 

156 atmExcludeCmd = {} 

157 calTableCreated = False 

158 

159 # Store "all TDM" information before trying the renormalization so 

160 # that the weblog is rendered properly. 

161 alltdm = rn.tdm_only 

162 

163 # Only attempt the correction if the data are not all TDM. 

164 if not alltdm: 

165 # Run the renormalisation. 

166 rn.renormalize(createCalTable=create_cal_table, fillTable=create_cal_table, docorrThresh=threshold, spws=spw, excludechan=excludechan, 

167 atmAutoExclude=atm_auto_exclude, bwthreshspw=bwthreshspw, datacolumn='DATA') 

168 

169 # Create spectra plots. 

170 rn.plotSpectra(includeSummary=False) 

171 

172 # Check if the renormalisation has been saved to a cal table.  

173 calTableCreated = os.path.exists(rn.rntable) 

174 

175 # Get stats (dictionary) indexed by source, spw 

176 stats = rn.rnpipestats 

177 

178 # Get all factors for QA 

179 rnstats = rn.stats() 

180 

181 # get information related to detecting false positives caused by 

182 # atmospheric features, also needed for QA. 

183 atmWarning = rn.atmWarning 

184 atmExcludeCmd = rn.atmExcludeCmd 

185 

186 

187 # Clean up. 

188 rn.close() 

189 

190 return alltdm, atmExcludeCmd, atmWarning, calTableCreated, rnstats, stats

281 self.msmeta.fdmspws(), 

282 self.msmeta.spwsforintent('OBSERVE_TARGET#ON_SOURCE')

309

332 def getBscan(self,spw,verbose=False): 

333 Bspw=[] 

334 Bscans=self.msmeta.scansforintent('*BANDPASS*') 

335 Spwscans=self.msmeta.scansforspw(spw) 

336 for iB in Bscans: 

337 mask=Spwscans==iB 

338 for iS in Spwscans[mask]: 

339 Bspw.append(iS) 

340 if verbose: 

341 casalog.post(" Bandpass scan(s): "+str(Bspw)) 

342 

343 return Bspw

359 def getStateIdsForIntent(self,intent): 

360 if len(self.states)==0: 

361 mytb.open(self.msname+'/STATE') 

362 self.states=mytb.getcol('OBS_MODE') 

363 mytb.close() 

364 

365 return list(np.array(range(len(self.states)))[np.transpose([intent in y for y in self.states])])

368 def getBtsysscan(self,spw, verbose=True): 

369 

370 Bflds=list(self.msmeta.fieldsforintent('*BANDPASS*')) # Bandpass field(s) 

371 Bscans=[] 

372 for iBfld in Bflds: # handle multiple B calibrators (needed?) 

373 Bscans=Bscans+list(self.msmeta.scansforfield(iBfld)) # Scans on Bandpass field(s) 

374 TsysScans=list(self.msmeta.scansforintent('*ATM*')) # all Tsys scans 

375 SpwScans=list(self.msmeta.scansforspw(spw)) # Scans in specified spw 

376 

377 # [scan in [scans on Bfld among Tsys scans] among spw scans] 

378 BTsysScans=[iscan for iscan in [iscan1 for iscan1 in TsysScans if iscan1 in Bscans] if iscan in SpwScans] 

379 

380 if len(BTsysScans)<1: 

381 casalog.post('Could not find Tsys scan on B calibrator in spw='+str(spw)) 

382 return None 

383 

384 if verbose: 

385 casalog.post('Tsys scan(s) for bandpass calibrator(s) {0} in spw={1} are: {2}'.format(Bflds, spw, BTsysScans)) 

386 

387 # already a list 

388 return BTsysScans

390 def getACdata(self,scan,spw,field,rowave=False,stateid=[]): 

391 sortlist='' 

392 if rowave: 

393 sortlist='ANTENNA1' 

394 

395 mytb.open(self.msname) 

396 #ddid=str(list(self.msmeta.datadescids(spw))) 

397 ddid = str(self.msmeta.datadescids(spw).tolist()) 

398 # deal with numpy 2.0 strict data typing 

399 if isinstance(scan, (list, np.ndarray)): 

400 scans = str(np.asarray(scan).tolist()) 

401 else: 

402 scans = str(scan) 

403 if field is not None: # i.e. science data 

404 #quer='SCAN_NUMBER IN ['+str(scan)+'] && DATA_DESC_ID IN '+ddid+' && ANTENNA1==ANTENNA2 && FIELD_ID=='+str(field)  

405 quer='SCAN_NUMBER IN ['+scans+'] && DATA_DESC_ID IN '+ddid+' && ANTENNA1==ANTENNA2 && FIELD_ID=='+str(field) 

406 else: 

407 # because the getTsysSpectra passes scans but wont pass the field or Bandpass doesn't pass field actually 

408 #quer='SCAN_NUMBER IN ['+str(scan)+'] && DATA_DESC_ID IN '+ddid+' && ANTENNA1==ANTENNA2'  

409 quer='SCAN_NUMBER IN ['+scans+'] && DATA_DESC_ID IN '+ddid+' && ANTENNA1==ANTENNA2' 

410 

411 if len(stateid)>0: 

412 quer=quer+'&& STATE_ID IN '+str(stateid) 

413 st=mytb.query(quer,sortlist=sortlist) 

414 

415 d=st.getcol('DATA').real 

416 # If we want to incorporate the XML flags then need to grab them 

417 #f=st.getcol('FLAG') 

418 

419 # need a check here for failed data read - happens for aborted data (e.g. in Mosaics ALMA-IMF) 

420 # aborted means in a given scan the 'last' fiels is not necessarily recorded 

421 # simply 

422 

423 if len(d)>0: 

424 if d.shape[0] == 4: 

425 d=d[0::(d.shape[0]-1),:,:] # parallel hands only for full pol data 

426 a1=st.getcol('ANTENNA1') ## WARNING will CASA 6.2 obey row ordering if getcol ANT is not called with DATA ?? 

427 st.close() 

428 mytb.close() 

429 

430 dsh=d.shape 

431 if rowave and dsh[2]%self.nAnt==0: 

432 dsh2=(dsh[0],dsh[1],self.nAnt,int(dsh[2]/self.nAnt)) 

433 d=np.mean(d.reshape(dsh2),3) 

434 a1=np.sum(a1.reshape(dsh2[2:]),1)//dsh2[3] 

435 

436 ## Some details for how to incorporate flagging if that was wanted in the future: 

437 # if (f == True).any(): #if there are no flags then just do as above 

438 # d = d.reshape(dsh2) 

439 # f = f.reshape(dsh2) 

440 # d = np.ma.array(d, mask=f, fill_value=np.nan) 

441 # d = np.nanmean(d,3) 

442 #  

443 # Note that if this is run after the PL flagging (stage 2) then EVERYTHING is 

444 # flagged because the PL flags autocorrs.  

445 else: 

446 d = None # new return which is analysed in the renorm code now  

447 mytb.close() 

448 return d

450 # Mimics part of getXCdata, but gets the FLAG column 

451 def getXCflags(self,scan,spw,field,datacolumn='FLAG', verbose=False): 

452 if verbose: 

453 casalog.post(' Extracting CROSS-correlation flags from spw='+str(spw)+' and scan='+str(scan)+' and field='+str(field)) 

454 

455 mytb.open(self.msname) 

456 

457 if mytb.colnames().count(datacolumn)==0: 

458 mytb.close() 

459 casalog.post('ERROR: '+str(datacolumn)+' does NOT exist!') 

460 raise RuntimeError(str(datacolumn)+' does not exist.') 

461 

462 #ddid=str(list(self.msmeta.datadescids(spw))) 

463 #st=mytb.query('SCAN_NUMBER IN ['+str(scan)+'] && DATA_DESC_ID IN '+ddid+' && ANTENNA1!=ANTENNA2 && FIELD_ID =='+str(field)) 

464 ddid = str(self.msmeta.datadescids(spw).tolist()) 

465 # Deal with numpy 2.0 strict data typing 

466 if isinstance(scan, (list, np.ndarray)): 

467 scans = str(np.asarray(scan).tolist()) 

468 else: 

469 scans = str(scan) 

470 st = mytb.query('SCAN_NUMBER IN ['+scans+'] && DATA_DESC_ID IN '+ddid+' && ANTENNA1!=ANTENNA2 && FIELD_ID =='+str(field)) 

471 cd=st.getcol(datacolumn) 

472 a1=st.getcol('ANTENNA1') 

473 a2=st.getcol('ANTENNA2') 

474 st.close() 

475 mytb.close() 

476 

477 # idea is actually to return a list of fully flagged antennas 

478 

479 # each row in the XC flags is a unique antenna pair 

480 # loop the rows and make a list of those that are NOT fully flagged, then use exclusion  

481 # comparing to the list of all antennas 

482 

483 gdants=[] 

484 for irow in range(cd.shape[2]): 

485 if np.sum(cd[:,:,irow]) != cd.shape[0]*cd.shape[1]: # i.e here we are summing all corrs and the spectral axis 

486 gdants.append(a1[irow]) 

487 gdants.append(a2[irow]) 

488 

489 # now make an exclusion cause 

490 aout = [iant for iant in range(self.nAnt) if iant not in gdants] 

491 

492 # probably this could be coded better - instead of the loop??? - but is relatively fast as robust  

493 

494 return (aout)

497 def getTsysSpectra(self,scan,spw): 

498 

499 # get the sky 

500 atmoff=self.getACdata(scan,spw,None,True,self.getStateIdsForIntent('ATMOSPHERE#OFF')) 

501 

502 # get hot 

503 atmhot=self.getACdata(scan,spw,None,True,self.getStateIdsForIntent('ATMOSPHERE#HOT')) 

504 

505 # divide sky by hot (removes bandpass, etc.) 

506 Tatm=atmoff/atmhot 

507 

508 # norm on Chan axis: 

509 Tatm=self.normChanAxis(Tatm) 

510 

511 return Tatm 

512 

513 

514 def normChanAxis(self,A): 

515 # this is for the Tsys checking part/plotting  

516 (n0,n1,n2)=A.shape 

517 

518 # Normalize each spectrum by median 

519 for i2 in range(n2): 

520 for i0 in range(n0): 

521 A[i0,:,i2]/=np.median(A[i0,:,i2]) 

522 

523 return A

526 def xyplots(self,N): 

527 nY=int(floor(sqrt(N)+0.5)) 

528 nX=int(ceil(float(N)/nY)) 

529 return nX,nY

532 def plotSpws(self,hardcopy=True): # unchanged George's code (expect figure output name nad hardcopy=True -- I've not really used (L.Maud) 

533 

534 casalog.post('Discerning spw intents...') 

535 

536 specspws=list(self.msmeta.almaspws(tdm=True,fdm=True)) 

537 

538 scispws=list(self.msmeta.spwsforintent('*TARGET*')) 

539 scispecspws=[ispw for ispw in scispws if ispw in specspws ] 

540 casalog.post('Found resolved Science spws: '+str(scispecspws)) 

541 

542 tsysspws=list(self.msmeta.spwsforintent('*ATM*')) 

543 tsysspecspws=[ispw for ispw in tsysspws if ispw in specspws ] 

544 casalog.post('Found resolved Tsys spws = '+str(tsysspecspws)) 

545 

546 nSpw=len(tsysspecspws) 

547 plt.ioff() 

548 pfig=plt.figure(15,figsize=(14,9)) 

549 plt.ioff() 

550 pfig.clf() 

551 

552 for ispw in scispecspws: 

553 f=self.msmeta.chanfreqs(ispw,'GHz') 

554 plt.plot(f,len(f)*[ispw+0.01],'r-',lw=3) 

555 plt.text(max(f),ispw+0.01,str(ispw),fontsize=10) 

556 

557 for ispw in tsysspecspws: 

558 f=self.msmeta.chanfreqs(ispw,'GHz') 

559 plt.plot(f,np.array(len(f)*[ispw])-0.1,'b-',lw=3) 

560 plt.text(min(f),ispw-0.1,str(ispw)+'-Tsys',ha='right',va='top',fontsize=10) 

561 #plt.text(min(f),ispw,'Tsys',ha='right',va='center',fontsize=10) 

562 

563 

564 flo,fhi,spwlo,spwhi=plt.axis() 

565 

566 tdmspws=self.msmeta.almaspws(tdm=True) 

567 for ispw in tsysspecspws: 

568 if ispw in tdmspws: 

569 f=self.msmeta.chanfreqs(ispw,'GHz') 

570 plt.plot([f[0]]*2,[spwlo,spwhi],'b:') 

571 plt.plot([f[-1]]*2,[spwlo,spwhi],'b:') 

572 

573 plt.xlabel('Frequency (GHz)') 

574 plt.ylabel('Spw Id') 

575 plt.title(self.msname,{'horizontalalignment': 'left', 'fontsize': 'medium','verticalalignment': 'bottom'}) 

576 plt.ticklabel_format(style='plain', useOffset=False) 

577 if hardcopy: 

578 os.makedirs('RN_plots', exist_ok=True) 

579 fname=self.msname+'_ReNormSpwVsFreq.png' 

580 casalog.post('Saving hardcopy plot: '+fname) 

581 plt.savefig('./RN_plots/'+fname) 

582 plt.close() 

583 else: 

584 plt.show() 

585

587 def plotRelTsysSpectra(self,spws=[],scans=[],normByB=True,fthresh=0.01,bwthresh=64e6,bwdiv=None,nfit=5,edge=0.025,hardcopy=True,retflchan=False, plotATM=True, verbose=False): 

588 # LM edited: 

589 # made log message  

590 # CASA 6 fix 

591 # default alarm/trigger changed to 0.01, i.e. 1% trigger not 0.002 (0.2%) as before 

592 # output channels are saved as class value - for later tsys template  

593 # verbose option 

594 # plotATM - will also show ATM transmission profile on the Tsys spectra to help DRs 

595 # REMOVED fitTDM - tired to fit TDM spws in chunks, but this diverges at breaks and just is a mess - don't use 

596 

597 

598 # LM Note - the bwthresh, bwdiv etc all work similarly to those for the main renorm code, but are not shared 

599 # so the default here is usually kept are per George's setup 

600 # this is probably ok, as anyway this is used only to identify possible channels 

601 # that need flagging. IF we are to rely on this code later and automate the channels to  

602 # flag in the Tsys, we need very careful testing as the fitting can really diverge at the edges and 

603 # causes upswings in the returned profile at the edges of TDM SPWs which are then triggering flags 

604 

605 usefthresh=self.fthresh 

606 if fthresh>0.0: 

607 usefthresh=fthresh 

608 

609 casalog.post('') 

610 casalog.post('Using fractional alarm threshold for Tsys Spectra='+str(usefthresh)) 

611 

612 self.nfit=nfit 

613 

614 if type(spws)!=list: 

615 casalog.post('Please specify spws as a list.') 

616 raise TypeError('input parameter "spws" must be a list') 

617 

618 if type(scans)!=list: 

619 casalog.post('Please specify scans as a list.') 

620 raise TypeError('input parameter "scans" must be a list') 

621 

622 # the spws to process (Tsys spws) 

623 tsysspecspws=[] 

624 if len(spws)==0: 

625 specspws=list(self.msmeta.almaspws(tdm=True,fdm=True)) 

626 tsysspws=list(self.msmeta.spwsforintent('*ATM*')) 

627 tsysspecspws=[ispw for ispw in tsysspws if ispw in specspws ] 

628 #spws=list(self.msmeta.almaspws(fdm=True)) 

629 casalog.post('Found Resolved Tsys spws = '+str(tsysspecspws)) 

630 

631 else: 

632 tsysspecspws=spws 

633 casalog.post('User supplied Tsys spws = '+str(tsysspecspws)) 

634 

635 # global list of target scans 

636 targtsysscans=[] 

637 if len(scans)==0: 

638 tsysscans=list(self.msmeta.scansforintent('*ATM*')) 

639 bandpassfields=list(self.msmeta.fieldsforintent('*BAND*')) 

640 fldforscans=self.msmeta.fieldsforscans(tsysscans,False,0,0,asmap=True) 

641 targtsysscans = [iscan for iscan in tsysscans if fldforscans[str(iscan)][0] not in bandpassfields ] 

642 #targscans=list(self.msmeta.scansforintent('*TARGET*')) 

643 casalog.post('Found science Tsys scans = '+str(targtsysscans)) 

644 

645 else: 

646 targtsysscans=scans 

647 casalog.post('User supplied Tsys scans = '+str(targtsysscans)) 

648 

649 nSpw=len(tsysspecspws) 

650 

651 nXspw,nYspw = self.xyplots(nSpw) 

652 

653 plt.ioff() 

654 pfig=plt.figure(14,figsize=(14,9)) 

655 plt.ioff() 

656 pfig.clf() 

657 

658 cols=['b','g','r','c','m'] 

659 ncol=len(cols) 

660 k=1 

661 

662 flch={} 

663 

664 for ispw in tsysspecspws: 

665 

666 if normByB: 

667 # discern the B TSYS scan 

668 Bscan=self.getBtsysscan(ispw,verbose=verbose) 

669 if Bscan is None: 

670 return 

671 # and get corr- and ant-dep B, time-averaged  

672 Btsys=self.getTsysSpectra(scan=Bscan,spw=ispw) 

673 

674 # Calculate channel chunks  

675 (nseg,dNchan) = self.calcChanRanges(ispw,bwthresh,bwdiv,verbose=True) # not an option for Tsys (yet - April 2) 

676 

677 # George's code for chan range - comes later in plots and Tsys edges are masked too  

678 nCha=self.msmeta.nchan(ispw) # Btsys.shape[1] 

679 chlo=int(ceil(edge*nCha)) 

680 chhi=nCha-1-chlo 

681 chans=range(chlo,nCha-chlo) 

682 

683 if plotATM: 

684 if type(Bscan) is list: 

685 Bscanatm=Bscan[0] 

686 else: 

687 Bscanatm=Bscan 

688 ATMprof = self.ATMtrans(Bscanatm, ispw, verbose=verbose) 

689 # mask edges same as the Tsys below,i.e. TDM coes from 128 to 120 channels 

690 ATMprof=ATMprof[chlo:(nCha-chlo)] 

691 

692 plt.subplot(nYspw,nXspw,k) 

693 plt.ioff() 

694 plt.ticklabel_format(style='plain', useOffset=False) 

695 if (k-1)%nXspw==0: 

696 plt.ylabel('Relative Tsys') 

697 

698 if k>(nSpw-nXspw): 

699 plt.xlabel('Channel') 

700 

701 if k==1: 

702 plt.title(self.msname+' <Nant='+str(self.nAnt)+'> Nscan='+str(len(targtsysscans)),{'horizontalalignment': 'left', 'fontsize': 'medium','verticalalignment': 'bottom'}) 

703 k+=1 

704 

705 c=-1 

706 

707 for iscan in targtsysscans: 

708 c+=1 # new color each scan 

709 

710 # this scan's Tsys 

711 Tsys=self.getTsysSpectra(iscan,ispw) 

712 

713 # Divid by Btsys to remove atm, mostly 

714 if normByB: 

715 Tsys/=Btsys 

716 

717 # normalize on channel axis 

718 Tsys=self.normChanAxis(Tsys) 

719 

720 # average over corrs, antennas 

721 Tsys=np.mean(Tsys,(0,self.num_corrs)) 

722 

723 # mask edges 

724 Tsys=Tsys[chlo:(nCha-chlo)] 

725 

726 # remove broad non-linearity (usually atm) -- this does not trigger for TDM at present  

727 if self.nfit>0: 

728 

729 for iseg in range(nseg): 

730 # Tsys was masked so rubbish edges are not fitted  

731 lochan=max(iseg*dNchan-chlo,0) 

732 hichan=min((iseg+1)*dNchan-chlo,len(Tsys)) 

733 if lochan<hichan: 

734 self.calcReNorm1(Tsys[lochan:hichan],False) 

735 

736 #for iant in range(Tsys.shape[1]): 

737 # plt.plot(Tsys[:,iant]) 

738 

739 plt.plot(chans,Tsys,cols[c%ncol]+'-') 

740 

741 

742 TsysMax=Tsys.max() 

743 TsysMedDev=np.median(np.absolute(Tsys-1.0)) 

744 TsysSfrac=np.mean(Tsys)-1.0 

745 alarm=' ' 

746 flchans=[] 

747 flchanstr='' 

748 if TsysMax>=(1.0+usefthresh): 

749 flchans=np.array(np.where(Tsys>(1.0+usefthresh))[0]) 

750 nflchan=len(flchans) 

751 if nflchan>0: 

752 flchans+=chlo 

753 spwkey='spw='+str(ispw) 

754 #if not flch.has_key(spwkey): ## HAS_KEY IS NOT IN CASA6 - PYTHON3 

755 # flch[spwkey]={} 

756 

757 if not spwkey in flch.keys(): 

758 flch[spwkey]={} 

759 

760 scankey='scan='+str(iscan) 

761 flch[spwkey][scankey]=flchans 

762 if verbose: 

763 flchanstr=' Found '+str(nflchan)+' channels in SPW '+str(ispw)+' execeeding fractional threshold ('+str(usefthresh)+')' 

764 plt.plot(flchans,[0.999]*nflchan,'ks',markersize=4) 

765 alarm=' ***' 

766 plt.plot([3*nCha/8,5*nCha/8],[TsysMax]*2,cols[c%ncol]+'-') 

767 note1='Peak='+str(floor(TsysMax*10000.0)/10000.0) 

768 plt.text(3*nCha/8,TsysMax,note1,ha='right',va='center',color=cols[c%ncol],size='x-small') 

769 note2='Intg~'+str(floor(TsysSfrac*10000.0)/10000.0) 

770 plt.text(5*nCha/8,TsysMax,note2,ha='left',va='center',color=cols[c%ncol],size='x-small') 

771 

772 

773 

774 pstr=" Science Tsys(spw={0:2d},scan={1:3d}): PEAK Frac Line Contrib={2:.4f}{3} INTEGRATED Frac Line Contrib={4:.4f}" 

775 if verbose: 

776 casalog.post(pstr.format(ispw,iscan,TsysMax,alarm,TsysSfrac)) 

777 

778 if len(flchanstr)>0: 

779 casalog.post(flchanstr) 

780 

781 lims=list(plt.axis()) 

782 lims[0]=chlo-1 

783 lims[1]=nCha-chlo 

784 lims[2]=min(0.9985,lims[2]) 

785 lims[3]=max(1.15*lims[3]-0.15*lims[2],1.02) 

786 plt.axis(lims) 

787 

788 dy=lims[2]*0.1+lims[3]*0.9 

789 plt.text(nCha/2,dy,'Spw='+str(ispw),ha='center') 

790 

791 # want second axis for ATM line  

792 # this is to aid DR in understading there is not a problem here 

793 # similar to pipeline Tsys plots with transmission shown 

794 # but keep simple with 0 to 100% shown only 

795 # and plot only once (while looping Target fields) - BP ATM profile is show 

796 # as the way Geogre coded the plots we can just called plt.twin and  

797 # thus 'shifts' to only registering about the new ATM 'axis' 

798 if plotATM: 

799 plt.twinx() 

800 plt.plot(chans,100.*ATMprof,c='m',linestyle='-',linewidth=2) 

801 plt.ylim(0,100) 

802 if (k-1)%nXspw==0: 

803 plt.ylabel('ATM transmission (%)') 

804 

805 if nXspw == 3: 

806 plt.subplots_adjust(wspace=0.35) 

807 else: 

808 plt.subplots_adjust(wspace=0.3) 

809 

810 if hardcopy: 

811 os.makedirs('RN_plots', exist_ok=True) 

812 fname=self.msname+'_RelTsysSpectra.png' 

813 casalog.post('Saving hardcopy plot: '+fname) 

814 plt.savefig('./RN_plots/'+fname) 

815 plt.close() 

816 else: 

817 plt.show() 

818 

819 # keep the channels in a dictionary  

820 self.TsysReturn = flch 

821 

822 if retflchan: 

823 return flch

826 def renormalize(self, spws=[], excludespws=[], targscans=[], 

827 excludeants=[], excludechan={}, excflagged=True, fixOutliers=True, mededge=0.01, 

828 atmAutoExclude=True, checkFalsePositives=True, correctATM=False, limATM=0.85, plotATM=True, 

829 bwdiv='odd', bwthresh=120e6, bwthreshspw={}, checkLineForest=True, nfit=5, useDynamicSegments=True, 

830 datacolumn='CORRECTED_DATA', createCalTable=False, fillTable=False, docorr=False, docorrThresh=None, usePhaseAC=False, 

831 antHeuristicsSpectra=True, diagSpectra=True, fthresh=0.01, 

832 verbose=False): 

833 """ 

834 Purpose: 

835 This is the main function of the ACreNorm class. It takes the  

836 autocorrelations and evaluates them to see if a rescaling of the 

837 crosscorrelation data is necessary. It does this by looping over 

838 the science targets on a per spw, per scan, per field, per antenna, 

839 per correlation basis. It takes the autocorrelations of the target 

840 and divides them by a calibrator's autocorrelations (by default the 

841 bandpass) and any peaks above 2% in the resultant spectrum are  

842 caused by actual detections of the science target and therefore  

843 need to be corrected in the crosscorrelation data.  

844 

845 Inputs: 

846 This function has many options for evaluating the autocorrelations 

847 and applying solutions if necessary but no inputs are necessary 

848 for operation. Some options are highly experimental and not  

849 recommended for blind usage, they have been noted below. 

850 

851 -------------- 

852 Data Selection 

853 -------------- 

854 

855 excludespws : list of integers 

856 If not empty, any spw specified will be removed from analysis 

857 if that spw is one of the science spws.  

858 Example: excludespws = [21] 

859 Default: excludespws = [] 

860 

861 spws : list of integers 

862 If not empty, only perform renormalization on the spws that 

863 are specified. Note that these must be science spws or they 

864 will be ignored. 

865 Example: spws = [21,23] 

866 Default: spws = [] 

867 

868 targscans : list of integers 

869 If not empty, only perform renormalization on the target scans 

870 that are specified. Note that these scans must contain science 

871 data or they will be ignored.  

872 Example: targscans = [18,21,24,27] 

873 Default: targscans = [] 

874 

875 -------------- 

876 Data Reduction 

877 -------------- 

878 

879 excludeants : list of integers 

880 Specified antennas will be ignored in all analysis and  

881 application. This is intended to be used if any antenna are  

882 problematic in the interferometric data or need manually  

883 flagging. This is normally done via the excflagged option but  

884 if the data were just imported then flags are not available  

885 and this can be used instead. Excluded antennas have their 

886 scaling spectra set to 1.0. 

887 Example: excludeants = [10,32] 

888 Default: excludeants = [] 

889 

890 excludechan : dictionary  

891 If problematic data is found across a series of channels (often 

892 from atmospheric features) then the spw and channel ranges can 

893 be specified in either channel or frequency space (TOPO, GHz). 

894 Excluded channels have their scaling spectra set to 1.0. 

895 Example: excludechan={'22':'100~150;800~850', '24':'100~200'} 

896 excludechan={'22':'230.1GHz~230.2GHz'} 

897 Default: excludechan={} 

898 

899 excflagged : boolean 

900 Excluded flagged antenna by reading the crosscorrelation flag 

901 tables per spw, per scan, and per field. Antennas are excluded 

902 if fully flagged. Only useful after the data are fully  

903 calibrated. Fully flagged antenna will have thier scaling  

904 spectra set to 1.0. 

905 Default: excflagged = True 

906 

907 fixOutliers : boolean 

908 Check antennas individually per scan, field, and correlation 

909 for outlier data compared to the median spectrum across all  

910 antennas for that correlation on a channel-by-channel basis.  

911 Outlier data is set to the median spectrum value of the  

912 corresponding correlation. 

913 Default: fixOutliers = True 

914 

915 mededge : float 

916 Percentage of edge channels to set to the median spectrum  

917 value to prevent edge effects from influencing results. 

918 Default: mededge = 0.01 (i.e. 1%) 

919 

920 --------------------- 

921 Atmosphere Mitigation 

922 --------------------- 

923 

924 atmAutoExclude : boolean 

925 This option works in conjunction with the checkFalsePositives 

926 option to identify problematic sections of the spectrum where 

927 the atmosphere may be causing issues. If set to True, this will 

928 automatically exclude those sections of the spectrum where  

929 there are atmospheric features using the same method as the 

930 excludechan option. 

931 Default: atmAutoExclude = True 

932  

933 checkFalsePositives : boolean 

934 This will automatically find atmospheric lines in the spectrum  

935 and check those regions to see if there is a renorm signal  

936 above the threshold. If there is, it is assumed to be a "false  

937 positive" signal caused by the ATM feature and will trigger a 

938 warning as well as a suggested region to exclude from analysis. 

939 Default: checkFalsePositives = True 

940 

941 correctATM : boolean : EXPERIMENTAL - NOT RECOMMENDED 

942 This will get the transmission profiles for the bandpass (or 

943 phase) and target(s) and create a ratio of those profiles and 

944 apply it to the scaling spectrum. Becuase the bandpass (or 

945 phase) and target(s) autocorrelations are compared in  

946 establishing the scaling spectra, there can be issues where  

947 transmission is low and/or the source elevations are different  

948 by a significant amount resulting in very different atmospheric  

949 effects. This option acts to fix this discrpancy so that  

950 atmospheric features are handled correction.  

951 NOTE: Although a good idea, in practice it appears to have  

952 little effect and sometimes does more harm. 

953 Default: correctATM = False 

954 

955 limATM : float 

956 Set the transmission limit for atmospheric features so that 

957 only when features are below the set limit are they mitigated. 

958 This helps with computation time as there are diminishing  

959 returns on dealing with minor atmospheric features. 

960 Default: limATM = 0.85 

961 

962 plotATM : boolean 

963 If set to True, plot the atmospheric transmission curve on a 

964 secondary y-axis. 

965 Default: plotATM = True 

966 

967 ---------- 

968 Baselining 

969 ---------- 

970 

971 bwdiv : None, 'odd', int 

972 If a spw needs to be broken up into chunks (see bwthresh), this 

973 option determines the behavior of the division process. The  

974 input here will be applied to all spws. There are three input 

975 options available:  

976 1. None - This will use powers of 2 based on taking the  

977 full spw bandwidth and dividing by bwthresh option. 

978 2. 'odd' - This follows the process of (1) but attempts to 

979 force an odd number of segments of equal size. 

980 3. int - This will divide the spw bandwidth by the input  

981 integer to create segments of equal size.  

982 

983 NOTE: For options (2) and (3) there is a possiblity that the 

984 total number of channels does not evenly divide into an  

985 integer number of channels. For example, 2048 channels divided 

986 by 3 segments is 682 channels per segment with a remainder of 2 

987 channels. In these cases, the mededge option is considered as 

988 this will flag a number of edge channels anyway. If the number 

989 of channels in the remainder is smaller than the flagged region 

990 then the solution is kept, otherwise the solution defaults to 

991 option (1).  

992 

993 NOTE: The total number of segments is capped at 7 which will 

994 override any input here. 

995 

996 Examples: bwdiv = None 

997 bwdiv = 'odd' 

998 bwdiv = 4 

999 Default: bwdiv = 'odd' 

1000 

1001 

1002 bwthresh : float 

1003 The maximum bandwidth (in Hz) to fit a baseline to, beyond this 

1004 limit the spw will be broken into chunks to fit separately. 

1005 NOTE: The maximum number of segments is capped at 7. This will 

1006 override this setting for wide spws.  

1007 Default: bwthresh = 120e6 

1008 

1009 bwthreshspw : dictionary 

1010 This allows the user to input specific settings of the bwthresh 

1011 option on a per spw basis, spws not specifed here will default  

1012 to the bwthresh option setting. 

1013 Example: bwthreshspw = {'22':'250e6', '24':'500e6'} 

1014 Default: {} 

1015 

1016 checkLineForest : boolean 

1017 Each segment goes through a process of masking to find and  

1018 ignore potential lines. Atmospheric features are also ignored.  

1019 After this masking, this option will enable to a check to make 

1020 sure that >50% of the remaining segment bandwidth is available 

1021 for fitting a baseline to. If not, then a warning is issued and 

1022 if useDynamicSegments is also set to True, then the segment  

1023 size will be increased to include more bandwidth. 

1024 NOTE: This only works if useDynamicSegments is also True. 

1025 Default: True 

1026 

1027 nfit : int 

1028 This is the order of the polynomial that is used to fit the 

1029 scaling spectrum in order to flatten or baseline it. 

1030 Default: nfit = 5 

1031 

1032 useDynamicSegments : boolean 

1033 If set to True, then after fitting the scaling spectrum, check 

1034 for issues at the segment boundaries by looking for values  

1035 >1.05 in the resultant scaling spectrum that are within 10  

1036 channels or 10 MHz (whichever is larger). If any values are  

1037 found, then decrease the number of segments by 2 and try again. 

1038 This process is repeated until a good solution is found or 

1039 only 1 segment remains. 

1040 Default: True 

1041 

1042 --------------- 

1043 Data Correction 

1044 --------------- 

1045 

1046 datacolumn : string 

1047 Specify the data column of the MS to apply the corrections to. 

1048 If this is run post-calibration, then the CORRECTED_DATA column 

1049 will exist and will need to be corrected by the scaling  

1050 spectrum calculated here. This is preferred as the code will be 

1051 able to take advantage of any flagging performed during  

1052 calibration (if the excflagged option is set to True).  

1053 Alternatively, if this is run pre-calibration, then the DATA 

1054 column of the MS can be selected, this however will modify the 

1055 raw data directly so it is not recommended.  

1056 Default: datacolumn = 'CORRECTED_DATA' 

1057 

1058 docorr : boolean 

1059 DEPRECATED - Now performs the same function as createCalTable. 

1060 

1061 createCalTable : boolean 

1062 Specify whether or not to create a calibration table which can  

1063 then be applied to the MS via an applycal.  

1064 Default: createCalTable=False 

1065 

1066 fillTable : boolean 

1067 This is a sub-parameter of createCalTable in that it does nothing 

1068 unless createCalTable is set to True. If this option is set to  

1069 True then targets, spws, scans, and fields where renorm is not  

1070 needed will still be added to the final calibration table. This 

1071 also includes TDM spws.  

1072 Default: False 

1073 

1074 docorrThresh : None or float 

1075 The threshold above which to apply the scaling spectrum to the  

1076 data. It has been determined by ALMA that datasets that do not 

1077 have any residuals in their scaling spectra above 2% do not  

1078 need to be corrected. As such, the default is set to 1.02  

1079 across all Bands. 

1080 Example: docorrThresh = 1.01 

1081 Default: docorrThresh = None (this results in 1.02 being set) 

1082 

1083 usePhaseAC : boolean : EXPERIMENTAL - USE WITH CAUTION 

1084 The bandpass calibrator is used by default to create the  

1085 scaling spectrum as it, by definition, should have no spectral 

1086 features. However, because it can be very far away in elevation 

1087 it can cause significant residuals due to atmospheric effects. 

1088 In those cases, it may be useful to use the Phase calibrator 

1089 instead as it must be within 3 degrees of the target. Note  

1090 however that the phase calibrator is not guaranteed to be free 

1091 of line emission or be free of wide-spread emission from the 

1092 target itself for cases like Orion where CO is pervasive.  

1093 If this option is set to True, then the phase calibrator will 

1094 be used to create the scaling spectra instead of the bandpass. 

1095 Default: False 

1096 

1097 ------------- 

1098 Data Analysis 

1099 ------------- 

1100 

1101 antHeuristicsSpectra : boolean 

1102 Create additional heuristics plots per antenna for diagnosing 

1103 and fixing bad autocorrelation data as described by the 

1104 fixOutliers option. 

1105 Default: True 

1106 

1107 diagSpectra : boolean 

1108 Create additional diagnostic spectra for each spw, scan, and  

1109 field with both X and Y correlations and all antennas on the  

1110 same plot along with the median spectra per correlation. These 

1111 plots show the actual correction that is applied per antenna. 

1112 Defualt: True 

1113 

1114 fthresh : float 

1115 This is the threshold above which to show an alarm trigger in 

1116 print statements and logs as "***". Stands for "fractional 

1117 alarm" threshold. 

1118 Default: 0.01 (i.e. 1%) 

1119 

1120 ----- 

1121 Misc. 

1122 ----- 

1123 

1124 verbose : boolean 

1125 Print additional messages to the terminal that normally only go 

1126 into the log file along with some "debug" type statements. 

1127 Default: False 

1128  

1129 Outputs: 

1130 Varies by the options selected above but at minimum the scaling  

1131 spectra are calculated and optionally a cal table is produced. 

1132 """ 

1133 # Starting CASA logger message 

1134 casalog.post('*** ALMA almarenorm.py ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

1135 casalog.post('*** '+str(self.RNversion)+' ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

1136 casalog.post('*** Beginning renormalization run ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

1137 

1138 casalog.post('') 

1139 casalog.post('*** ALMA almarenorm.py renormalize '+str(self.RNversion)+' ***') 

1140 

1141 usefthresh=self.fthresh 

1142 if fthresh>0.0: 

1143 usefthresh=fthresh 

1144 

1145 casalog.post('') 

1146 casalog.post('Using fractional alarm indication threshold for ReNorm = '+str(usefthresh*100)+'%') 

1147 

1148 if correctATM: 

1149 self.corrATM = True 

1150 casalog.post('Will account for any ATM lines within the SPWs') 

1151 

1152 # Handle correction request 

1153 if docorr or createCalTable: 

1154 createCalTable = True 

1155 docorr = True 

1156 if datacolumn=='CORRECTED_DATA' and not self.correxists: 

1157 casalog.post('Correction of CORRECTED_DATA requested, but column does not exist! Switching to DATA column.') 

1158 datacolumn='DATA' 

1159 

1160 casalog.post('The '+str(datacolumn)+' column will be analyzed for normalization issues.') 

1161 

1162 # One has the ability to input the name of a caltable while creating the ACreNorm object. 

1163 # If that hasn't been done yet, default to a simple name. 

1164 if not self.rntable: 

1165 # Name our new calibration table 

1166 self.rntable = self.msname+'.renorm.tbl' 

1167 

1168 # Use the Calibrator Tool to create an empty cal table for us to put results into.  

1169 # We want to create a TSYS table since this is a multiplication correction.  

1170 casalog.post('Creating a calibration table to store renorm solutions: '+self.rntable) 

1171 mycb.open(filename=self.msname, compress=False, addcorr=False, addmodel=False) 

1172 mycb.createcaltable( 

1173 caltable = self.rntable, 

1174 partype = 'Real', # or Float? 

1175 caltype = 'B TSYS', 

1176 singlechan = False 

1177 ) 

1178 mycb.close() 

1179 

1180 # Define a new table tool instance for this table 

1181 self.rntb = tbtool() 

1182 self.rntb.open(self.rntable, nomodify=False) 

1183 

1184 # Need to keep track of the number of times we write to the renorm table.  

1185 rntb_iter = 0 

1186 

1187 if fillTable: 

1188 casalog.post('All targets, scans, spws will be filled in resulting calibration table. This may greatly enlarge the size of the final table!') 

1189 casalog.post(f'TDM windows {self.tdmspws} will also be included in {self.rntable}.') 

1190 

1191 else: 

1192 casalog.post('No corrections will be saved (createCalTable=False)!') 

1193 fillTable=False 

1194 

1195 # Check if docorrThresh is set correctly 

1196 if docorrThresh is not None: 

1197 if type(docorrThresh) is not float: 

1198 casalog.post('Correction of CORRECTED_DATA requested, but docorrThresh is set incorrectly! Cannot procede.') 

1199 casalog.post(' set to None for automatic thresholding during apply, or input a float to use') 

1200 casalog.post('*** Terminating renormalization run ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

1201 raise TypeError('Correction of CORRECTED_DATA requested, but docorrThresh is set incorrectly. Use None or float.') 

1202 if docorrThresh > 1.5: 

1203 casalog.post('WARNING: Correction of CORRECTED_DATA requested, but docorrThresh is set very high') 

1204 casalog.post(' docorrThresh is a factor above which to apply the ReNormalization') 

1205 casalog.post(' '+str(docorrThresh)+' is very high and it is likely that no data will pass that limit') 

1206 hardLim = docorrThresh 

1207 else: 

1208 hardLim = docorrThresh 

1209 else: 

1210 hardLim = self.bandThresh[self.Band] 

1211 

1212 if createCalTable: 

1213 casalog.post('####################') 

1214 casalog.post(f'Using threshold for Renorm = {hardLim}') 

1215 casalog.post('Only spws where fields exceed this will have corrections >1.0 saved') 

1216 casalog.post('####################') 

1217 else: 

1218 casalog.post('Using threshold limit of '+str(hardLim)+' for renormalization determination') 

1219 

1220 self.nfit=nfit 

1221 self.fthresh=fthresh 

1222 

1223 self.rnstats={} 

1224 self.rnstats['inputs'] = {} 

1225 self.rnstats['inputs']['bwthresh'] = bwthresh 

1226 self.rnstats['inputs']['bwdiv'] = bwdiv 

1227 self.rnstats['inputs']['bwthreshspw'] = bwthreshspw 

1228 

1229 # the spws to process (FDM only) 

1230 if len(spws)==0: 

1231 spws=list(self.fdmspws) 

1232 casalog.post('Found FDM spws = '+str(spws)) 

1233 else: 

1234 # Force input list to be of type int 

1235 if type(spws[0]) is str: 

1236 for i in range(len(spws)): 

1237 spws[i] = int(spws[i]) 

1238 casalog.post('User supplied spws = '+str(spws)) 

1239 if not any(uspw in spws for uspw in list(self.fdmspws)): 

1240 casalog.post('User supplied spw(s) are not in the list of FDM spws => '+str(self.fdmspws)) 

1241 raise SyntaxError('User supplied spw(s) are not in the list of FDM spws => '+str(self.fdmspws)) 

1242 

1243 if len(excludespws)>0: 

1244 casalog.post('Will exclude spws='+str(excludespws)) 

1245 for espw in excludespws: 

1246 if spws.count(espw)>0: 

1247 spws.remove(espw) 

1248 

1249 casalog.post('Will process spws = '+str(spws)) 

1250 

1251 self.rnstats['spws']=spws 

1252 

1253 # List of target scans if user didn't input any 

1254 if not targscans: 

1255 targscans=list(self.msmeta.scansforintent('*TARGET*')) 

1256 

1257 casalog.post('Will process science target scans='+str(targscans)) 

1258 

1259 self.nScan=len(targscans) 

1260 

1261 # This sets up rnstats for later summary plots 

1262 self.rnstats['scans']=targscans 

1263 self.rnstats['rNmax']=np.zeros((self.num_corrs,self.nAnt,len(spws),len(targscans))) 

1264 self.rnstats['rNmdev']=np.zeros((self.num_corrs,self.nAnt,len(spws),len(targscans))) 

1265 self.rnstats['N']={} 

1266 self.rnstats['N_atm']={} 

1267 self.rnstats['N_thresh']={} # same as N except only populated when the hardLim is reached 

1268 

1269 # Excludeants function 

1270 if len(excludeants) > 0: 

1271 # check type 

1272 if type(excludeants) is str: 

1273 casalog.post(' excludeants requires a list of antenna ID(s) or antenna Name(s)') 

1274 casalog.post(' e.g. [0,1] or ["DA44","DA45"]') 

1275 casalog.post('*** Terminating renormalization run ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

1276 raise TypeError('excludeants requires a list of antenna ID(s) or antenna name(s) (e.g. [0,1] or ["DA44", "DA55"]') 

1277 else: # note this does not check if the Antenna is actually in the Antenna Names list 

1278 if type(excludeants[0]) is str: 

1279 # convert to antenna ID 

1280 casalog.post('Will exclude antennas = '+str((',').join(excludeants))) 

1281 excludeants=[excn for excn,exca in enumerate(self.AntName) if exca in excludeants] 

1282 else: 

1283 casalog.post('Will exclude antennas = '+str((',').join(list(self.AntName[[excludeants]])))) 

1284 

1285 if excflagged: 

1286 casalog.post('For each spw, scan, field will exclude fully flagged antennas') 

1287 

1288 if diagSpectra: 

1289 casalog.post('Will plot diagnostic spectra per spw, scan, field') 

1290 

1291 if checkFalsePositives: 

1292 casalog.post('Will check for false positive renormalization triggers from atmospheric features.') 

1293 self.atmMask={} 

1294 self.atmWarning={} 

1295 self.atmExcludeCmd={} 

1296 

1297 if atmAutoExclude: 

1298 casalog.post('Regions of the spectrum where atmospheric lines are found will be excluded.') 

1299 checkFalsePositives = True 

1300 

1301 if excludechan: 

1302 # checkformats sucessively for fail modes 

1303 if type(excludechan) is not dict: 

1304 casalog.post(' excludechan requires a string dict input') 

1305 casalog.post(' e.g. {"22":"100~150"}') 

1306 casalog.post('*** Terminating renormalization run ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

1307 raise TypeError("excludechan parameter requires a string dict input.") 

1308 for excch in excludechan.keys(): 

1309 if type(excch) is not str: 

1310 casalog.post(' excludechan requires a string dict input') 

1311 casalog.post(' e.g. {"22":"100~150"}') 

1312 casalog.post('*** Terminating renormalization run ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

1313 raise TypeError('excludechan parameter requires a string dict input') 

1314 if int(excch) not in spws: 

1315 casalog.post(' excludechan specified SPW '+excch+' is not a SPW of this dataset') 

1316 casalog.post('*** Terminating renormalization run ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

1317 raise SyntaxError('Inconsistent input parameters: excludechan contains spws not in spw parameter') 

1318 if type(excludechan[excch]) is not str: 

1319 casalog.post(' excludechan requires a string dict input for channels') 

1320 casalog.post(' e.g. {"22":"100~150"}') 

1321 casalog.post('*** Terminating renormalization run ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

1322 raise TypeError('excludechan requires a stringdict input for channels') 

1323 if '~' not in excludechan[excch]: 

1324 casalog.post(' excludechan requires a channel range separator of "~"') 

1325 casalog.post(' e.g. {"22":"100~150"}') 

1326 casalog.post('*** Terminating renormalization run ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

1327 raise SyntaxError('excludechan requires a channel range separator of "~" (tilde)') 

1328 elif excludechan is None: 

1329 excludechan={} 

1330 elif type(excludechan) is str: 

1331 excludechan={} 

1332 # PIPE-1612: make a copy of the excludechan input so that it's not modified in the upstream code 

1333 self.rnstats['inputs']['excludechan'] = copy.deepcopy(excludechan) 

1334 

1335 if useDynamicSegments: 

1336 casalog.post('Will examine segment boundaries for possible issues and automatically resize.') 

1337 

1338 # Bwthreshspw (dictionary) 

1339 if bwthreshspw: 

1340 # check formats sucessively for fail modes 

1341 if type(bwthreshspw) is not dict: 

1342 casalog.post(' bwthreshspw requires a string dict input') 

1343 casalog.post(' e.g. {"22":120e6}') 

1344 casalog.post('*** Terminating renormalization run ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

1345 raise TypeError('bwthreshspw requires a string dict input') 

1346 for spwth in bwthreshspw.keys(): 

1347 if type(spwth) is not str: 

1348 casalog.post(' bwthreshspw requires the spw as a string input') 

1349 casalog.post(' e.g. {"22":120e6}') 

1350 casalog.post('*** Terminating renormalization run ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

1351 raise TypeError('bwthreshspw requires the spw as a string input') 

1352 if int(spwth) not in spws: 

1353 casalog.post(' bwthreshspw SPW specified is not a SPW of this dataset') 

1354 casalog.post('*** Terminating renormalization run ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

1355 raise SyntaxError('bwthreshspw SPW specified is not a SPW of this dataset') 

1356 if type(bwthreshspw[spwth]) is not float: 

1357 casalog.post(' bwthreshspw requires a float for the bw-threshold') 

1358 casalog.post(' e.g. {"22":120e6}') 

1359 casalog.post('*** Terminating renormalization run ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

1360 raise TypeError('bwthreshspw requires a float for the bw threshold') 

1361 if useDynamicSegments: 

1362 casalog.post(' bwthreshspw specified but useDynamicSegments was also specified.') 

1363 casalog.post(' I will use the user input and turn off dynamic segmentation for specified spws.') 

1364 

1365 # Send all input options to the log file so it's clear what has been entered 

1366 casalog.post('Equivalent manual input:') 

1367 casalog.post('\nself.renormalize(excludespws='+str(excludespws)+', spws='+str(spws) \ 

1368 + ', targscans='+str(targscans)) 

1369 casalog.post(' excludeants='+str(excludeants)+', excludechan='+str(excludechan)\ 

1370 +', excflagged='+str(excflagged)+', fixOutliers='+str(fixOutliers)+', mededge='+str(mededge)) 

1371 casalog.post(' atmAutoExclude='+str(atmAutoExclude)+', checkFalsePositives='+str(checkFalsePositives) \ 

1372 +', correctATM='+str(correctATM)+', limATM='+str(limATM)+', plotATM='+str(plotATM)+',') 

1373 casalog.post(' bwdiv='+str(bwdiv)+', bwthresh='+str(bwthresh)+', bwthreshspw='+str(bwthreshspw) \ 

1374 +', checkLineForest='+str(checkLineForest)+', nfit='+str(nfit)+', useDynamicSegments=' \ 

1375 +str(useDynamicSegments)) 

1376 casalog.post(' datacolumn='+str(datacolumn)+', createCalTable='+str(createCalTable)+', fillTable='+str(fillTable) \ 

1377 +', docorrThresh='+str(docorrThresh)+', usePhaseAC='+str(usePhaseAC)) 

1378 casalog.post(' antHeuristicsSpectra='+str(antHeuristicsSpectra)+', diagSpectra='+str(diagSpectra) \ 

1379 +', fthresh='+str(fthresh)) 

1380 casalog.post(' verbose='+str(verbose)+')') 

1381 

1382 # Want to loop over sources so we can disentangle fields and sources and better plot what is happening 

1383 # for mosaics and multi-target observations.  

1384 target_list = np.unique(self.msmeta.namesforfields(self.msmeta.fieldsforintent('*TARGET*'))) 

1385 casalog.post('\nFound targets: '+str(target_list)) 

1386 for target in target_list: 

1387 self.rnstats['N'][target] = {} 

1388 self.rnstats['N_atm'][target] = {} 

1389 self.rnstats['N_thresh'][target] = {} 

1390 self.rnstats['inputs'][target] = {} 

1391 self.docorrApply[target] = {} 

1392 

1393 casalog.post('\n Processing Target='+str(target)+' ******************************') 

1394 

1395 # process each spw 

1396 dospws = np.intersect1d(spws, self.msmeta.spwsforfield(target)) 

1397 for ispw in dospws: 

1398 # Not all targets are in all scans, we need to iterate over only those scans containing the target 

1399 target_scans = np.intersect1d(self.msmeta.scansforintent('*TARGET*'), self.msmeta.scansforfield(target)) 

1400 

1401 # Make an additional cut to catch only those scans which contain the current spw (usually only relevant 

1402 # for spectral scan datasets) 

1403 target_scans = np.intersect1d(target_scans, self.msmeta.scansforspw(ispw)) 

1404 

1405 # If user input list of scans to use, cross check those with the list of all scans on targets to make 

1406 # sure it's necessary to perform this loop.  

1407 target_scans = np.intersect1d(target_scans, targscans) 

1408 

1409 # if there is no intersection of the input scan list and the list of scans with this target, break  

1410 # out of the spw loop and continue on to the next target. 

1411 if len(target_scans) == 0: 

1412 casalog.post('\n Target '+str(target)+' is not contained in the input scan list '+str(targscans)+'. Moving to next target.\n') 

1413 break 

1414 

1415 self.docorrApply[target][str(ispw)] = None # instantiating the spw dictionary for this target 

1416 

1417 casalog.post('\n Processing spw='+str(ispw)+' (nchan='+str(self.msmeta.nchan(ispw))+') ******************************') 

1418 

1419 # Setup for phase cal AC rather than Bandpass AC 

1420 if usePhaseAC: 

1421 # just pick up the full list of phase cal scans 

1422 # later work out which one we get the AC from within the loop over the target scans 

1423 casalog.post('Will use PHASE calibrator AutoCorr for comparisons') 

1424 Phscan=self.getPhscan(ispw,verbose) 

1425 # still need Bandpass scan for any ATM plots - these are only for illustration 

1426 Bscan=self.getBscan(ispw,verbose) 

1427 else: 

1428 # discern the B scan(s) which will be used - otherwise for using the phase AC we get it later 

1429 casalog.post('Will use BANDPASS source AutoCorr for comparisons') 

1430 Bscan=self.getBscan(ispw,verbose) 

1431 # and get corr- and ant-dep B, time-averaged  

1432 B=self.getACdata(Bscan,ispw,None,True) 

1433 

1434 # If correctATM then we need to get the ATM transmission for the bandpass 

1435 # this can happen outside the scan loop below where we get for the target 

1436 # and optionally for the phase cal 

1437 if correctATM: 

1438 if type(Bscan) is list: 

1439 Bscanatm = Bscan[0] 

1440 else: 

1441 Bscanatm = Bscan 

1442 if 'BandPass' not in self.atmtrans.keys(): 

1443 # make initiation check as we loop spw then 

1444 self.atmtrans['BandPass']={} 

1445 if str(Bscanatm) not in self.atmtrans['BandPass'].keys(): 

1446 self.atmtrans['BandPass'][str(ispw)]={} 

1447 self.atmtrans['BandPass'][str(ispw)][str(Bscanatm)]=self.ATMtrans(Bscanatm,ispw,verbose=True) 

1448 # here will make first call to ATMtrans, which can access resetting the correctATM 

1449 # global variable in case the PWV cannot be found for the data 

1450 

1451 # global list of scans with the current spw 

1452 spwscans=list(self.msmeta.scansforspw(ispw)) 

1453 

1454 if bwthreshspw: 

1455 # check if the spw is ispw and use different bwthreshold 

1456 if str(ispw) in bwthreshspw.keys(): 

1457 casalog.post(' Using SPW specific bwthresh of '+str(bwthreshspw[str(ispw)])+' for '+str(ispw)) 

1458 (nseg,dNchan) = self.calcChanRanges(ispw,bwthreshspw[str(ispw)],bwdiv,edge=mededge,verbose=verbose) 

1459 else: 

1460 # spw not in the bwthreshspw keys list - calculate channel chunks with defaults 

1461 (nseg,dNchan) = self.calcChanRanges(ispw,bwthresh,bwdiv,edge=mededge,verbose=verbose) 

1462 else: 

1463 # no bwthreshspw option - calculate channel chunks with defaults as normal 

1464 (nseg,dNchan) = self.calcChanRanges(ispw,bwthresh,bwdiv,edge=mededge,verbose=verbose) 

1465 

1466 self.rnstats['inputs'][target][str(ispw)] = {} 

1467 self.rnstats['inputs'][target][str(ispw)]['num_segments'] = [] 

1468 self.rnstats['inputs'][target][str(ispw)]['dNchan'] = [] 

1469 

1470 # init Norm spectra for this spw 

1471 self.rnstats['N'][target][str(ispw)]= np.zeros((self.num_corrs,self.msmeta.nchan(ispw),self.nAnt)) 

1472 self.rnstats['N_thresh'][target][str(ispw)] = np.zeros((self.num_corrs, self.msmeta.nchan(ispw), self.nAnt)) 

1473 

1474 # process each target scan 

1475 ngoodscan=0 

1476 ngoodscan_thresh=0 

1477 

1478 if fixOutliers: 

1479 self.AntOut[str(ispw)]={} 

1480 self.replacedCorr[str(ispw)]=[] 

1481 self.birdiechan[str(ispw)]=[] 

1482 # sets for list of known ants with channel outliers  

1483 

1484 casalog.post('Target is in the following scans: '+str(target_scans)) 

1485 

1486 # We want to apply over all fields even if only one field of a mosaic is over the limit.  

1487 # This will also catch anything that wobbles around the limit and make sure it is applied. 

1488 if createCalTable: 

1489 num_passes = 2 

1490 else: 

1491 num_passes = 1 

1492 second_pass = False 

1493 second_pass_required = False 

1494 for npass in range(num_passes): 

1495 # if num_passes = 2, then npass will be set to 0 on first loop and 1 on second loop (then stops when 2 is reached). 

1496 # So, if npass == 1, it's the second loop and if second_pass was *not* set to True at the end of the loop, we don't 

1497 # need to go through the loop again. 

1498 if npass==1 and not second_pass_required: 

1499 casalog.post('Threshold limit not reached for any field/scan of spw '+str(ispw)+' of target '+target+'.') 

1500 continue 

1501 # Same as previous but if second_pass_required is set to True, we need to apply the correction and run through the scan loop again. 

1502 elif npass==1 and second_pass_required: 

1503 second_pass = True 

1504 # Reset rntb_iter to remove previous values if any were accidentally written (i.e. corrections waffled near threshold value). 

1505 if fillTable and hold_rntb_iter != rntb_iter: 

1506 casalog.post('\n Fixing calibration table - removing last '+str(int((rntb_iter - hold_rntb_iter)*self.nAnt))+' rows and rewriting with true solutions.') 

1507 self.fixCalTable(hold_rntb_iter*self.nAnt, rntb_iter*self.nAnt) 

1508 rntb_iter = hold_rntb_iter 

1509 casalog.post('\nThreshold limit was reached for one or more fields/scans of spw '+str(ispw)+' of target '+target+'. Applying renormalization correction to all scans, fields, and polarizations.') 

1510 else: 

1511 pass 

1512 

1513 # If we find out in the middle of the scan set that a second pass is required and  

1514 # fillTable is set to True, then we will end up duplicating rows instead of overwriting  

1515 # those 1.0's with the real values that we want. Therefore, hold the current rntb_iter  

1516 # value so that we can reset it if needed later. 

1517 if fillTable: 

1518 hold_rntb_iter = rntb_iter 

1519 

1520 for iscan in target_scans: 

1521 casalog.post(' Processing scan='+str(iscan)+'------------------------------') 

1522 

1523 # LM added 

1524 # here we will get the Phasecal AC if requested 

1525 # this will be from the scan preceeding the target scan 

1526 # get the existing phase cal scan numerically lower than the target scan 'iscan' 

1527 if usePhaseAC: 

1528 scanIdx = int(np.where(np.array(Phscan)<iscan)[0][-1]) 

1529 casalog.post('**************** using the phase cal scan '+str(Phscan[scanIdx])+' *************************') 

1530 B=self.getACdata(Phscan[scanIdx],ispw,None,True) 

1531 if correctATM: 

1532 if 'PhaseCal' not in self.atmtrans.keys(): 

1533 self.atmtrans['PhaseCal']={} 

1534 if str(ispw) not in self.atmtrans['PhaseCal'].keys(): 

1535 self.atmtrans['PhaseCal'][str(ispw)]={} 

1536 if str(iscan) not in self.atmtrans['PhaseCal'][str(ispw)].keys(): 

1537 # now we know this field, spw and scan is not filled and we will calc it 

1538 # otherwise we just use what's there - i.e for a mosaic it doesn't redo for each ifld 

1539 # because the atm trans model reads scan level only 

1540 self.atmtrans['PhaseCal'][str(ispw)][str(Phscan[scanIdx])]=self.ATMtrans(Phscan[scanIdx],ispw,verbose=True) 

1541 

1542 # get the fields to process in this scan - i.e. mosaics have many fields per scan 

1543 Tarfld = list(self.msmeta.fieldsforscan(iscan)) 

1544 casalog.post(' Will process science target field(s) '+str(Tarfld)+' within this scan') 

1545 

1546 # holder for a max value per scan to print out  

1547 scanNmax=[] 

1548 

1549 # Now loop over the target fields 

1550 for ifld in Tarfld: 

1551 if verbose: 

1552 casalog.post(' Processing field='+str(ifld)+'-----------------------------') 

1553 

1554 # step over target scans that don't have the current spw 

1555 if spwscans.count(iscan)==0: 

1556 if verbose: 

1557 casalog.post('Scan='+str(iscan)+' is not a target scan in spw='+str(ispw)) 

1558 continue 

1559 

1560 # initiate the self.scalingValues dictionary 

1561 if str(ispw) not in self.scalingValues.keys(): 

1562 self.scalingValues[str(ispw)]={} 

1563 if str(iscan) not in self.scalingValues[str(ispw)].keys(): 

1564 self.scalingValues[str(ispw)][str(iscan)]={} 

1565 if str(ifld) not in self.scalingValues[str(ispw)][str(iscan)].keys(): 

1566 self.scalingValues[str(ispw)][str(iscan)][str(ifld)]=1.0 # default no scaling 

1567 

1568 # AutoCorr is divided by B (can be BANDPASS or PHASE cal AutoCorr)  

1569 # make if statement as getACdata can now return None if data was not filled 

1570 ToB=self.getACdata(iscan,ispw,ifld,True) 

1571 if ToB is not None: 

1572 ToB/=B 

1573 

1574 # Renorm function will be Nb0 divided by a fit 

1575 N=ToB.copy() 

1576 

1577 # get the ATM transmission here for target - above for BP and Phase already 

1578 # and fix the data - should we do per scan or bulk - bulk should be enough 

1579 # to get rid of the main defect so fitting will work close enough (one hopes) 

1580 if correctATM or checkFalsePositives: 

1581 # we are in iscan, ispw and ifld 

1582 # in a mosaic we are safe to use one field as representative 

1583 # because these differences are 'negligable'  

1584 # compared to possibly large ones we are trying to fix between the BP and target 

1585 fldname=self.msmeta.namesforfields(ifld)[0] 

1586 

1587 # need per scan, per spw - if we are just doing a bulk correction we miss any scan variations ???  

1588 

1589 if str(fldname) not in self.atmtrans.keys(): 

1590 self.atmtrans[str(fldname)]={} 

1591 if checkFalsePositives: 

1592 self.atmMask[str(fldname)]={} 

1593 self.atmWarning[str(fldname)]={} 

1594 self.atmExcludeCmd[str(fldname)] = {} 

1595 if str(ispw) not in self.atmtrans[str(fldname)].keys(): 

1596 self.atmtrans[str(fldname)][str(ispw)]={} 

1597 if checkFalsePositives: 

1598 self.atmMask[str(fldname)][str(ispw)]={} 

1599 self.atmWarning[str(fldname)][str(ispw)] = None 

1600 self.atmExcludeCmd[str(fldname)][str(ispw)] = None 

1601 if str(iscan) not in self.atmtrans[str(fldname)][str(ispw)].keys(): 

1602 # now we know this field, spw and scan is not filled and we will calc it 

1603 # otherwise we just use what's there - i.e for a mosaic it doesn't redo for each ifld 

1604 # because the atm trans model reads scan level only 

1605 self.atmtrans[str(fldname)][str(ispw)][str(iscan)]=self.ATMtrans(iscan,ispw,verbose=verbose) 

1606 

1607 # If desired, keep track of where ATM lines are so we can know if they are causing issues 

1608 if checkFalsePositives: 

1609 atm_mask = np.ones(N.shape[1], bool)*False 

1610 if self.Band in [9, 10]: 

1611 atm_centers, atm_gammas = self.fitAtmLines( 

1612 self.atmtrans[str(fldname)][str(ispw)][str(iscan)][0], int(ispw) 

1613 ) 

1614 atm_centers_SB, atm_gammas_SB = self.fitAtmLines( 

1615 self.atmtrans[str(fldname)][str(ispw)][str(iscan)][1], int(ispw) 

1616 ) 

1617 atm_centers += atm_centers_SB 

1618 atm_gammas += atm_gammas_SB 

1619 else: 

1620 atm_centers, atm_gammas = self.fitAtmLines( 

1621 self.atmtrans[str(fldname)][str(ispw)][str(iscan)], int(ispw) 

1622 ) 

1623 for cen, gam in zip(atm_centers, atm_gammas): 

1624 atm_mask[max(0,floor(cen-1.3*gam)):min(N.shape[1],ceil(cen+1.3*gam))] = True 

1625 self.atmMask[str(fldname)][str(ispw)][str(iscan)] = atm_mask 

1626 if atm_mask.any(): 

1627 self.atmExcludeCmd[str(fldname)][str(ispw)] = self.suggestAtmExclude( 

1628 target, str(ispw), return_command=True 

1629 ) 

1630 if atmAutoExclude: 

1631 # Get a dictionary returned of regions to exclude due to ATM lines 

1632 atm_exchan = self.suggestAtmExclude(target, str(ispw), return_dict=True) 

1633 # Merge ATM results with user input and update our accounting 

1634 excludechan = self.merge_dicts(excludechan, atm_exchan) 

1635 self.rnstats['inputs']['excludechan'].update(excludechan) 

1636 

1637 skipAtmCorr=True 

1638 if correctATM: 

1639 # check if we want to do the fix, if the ATM line is not strong 

1640 # it's a pointless calculation to work out the are differences 

1641 # between the BandPass and Target pointings 

1642 if np.min(self.atmtrans[str(fldname)][str(ispw)][str(iscan)])<limATM: 

1643 # * check now the global as if the ATM code previously didn't 

1644 # * find the correct PWV, only nominal values were input 

1645 # * and we probably don't want to use those for ATM correction 

1646 # * as it could make ATM residuals worse 

1647 if self.corrATM is False: 

1648 # statement that is won't do the correction 

1649 if verbose: 

1650 casalog.post('WARNING will not account for any ATM lines as requested as PWV not found') 

1651 else: 

1652 skipAtmCorr = False 

1653 # Want to keep a "clean" copy of the data so we can plot 

1654 # the original data and see the improvement. 

1655 N_atm = N.copy() 

1656 # now we pass to a function to do the correction 

1657 if usePhaseAC: 

1658 self.ATMcorrection(N,iscan,ispw,ifld,str(Phscan[scanIdx]),'PhaseCal', verbose=verbose) 

1659 # just edits the N in place - i.e. should flattens out the ATM region  

1660 # - could pass fldname also but re-gets this in ATM correction function 

1661 else: 

1662 # bscanatm already specified above  

1663 self.ATMcorrection(N,iscan,ispw,ifld,str(Bscanatm),'BandPass',verbose=True) 

1664 # just edits the N in place - i.e. should flattens out the ATM region  

1665 else: 

1666 casalog.post('No ATM features found below set limATM limit of '+str(limATM)+'. Skipping computation of ATM correction.') 

1667 skipAtmCorr = True 

1668 

1669 

1670 if excludechan: 

1671 # First check to make sure we have defined the N_atm variable as it holds the  

1672 # "original" copy of the spectrum before any ATM fixing. 

1673 if 'N_atm' not in locals(): 

1674 N_atm = N.copy() 

1675 

1676 # Now, what if N_atm exists due to an earlier spw but none of the above settings 

1677 # have updated it yet? 

1678 # 

1679 # If we are skipping explicit ATM correction but N_atm already exists, it needs  

1680 # to be updated. 

1681 if not self.corrATM and skipAtmCorr: 

1682 N_atm = N.copy() 

1683 

1684 # Now if this spw is in the list of spws that include exclusion, find the ranges 

1685 # and apply the exclusion (set data in channel ranges = 1.0) 

1686 if str(ispw) in excludechan.keys(): 

1687 ranges = [rng.strip() for rng in excludechan[str(ispw)].split(';')] 

1688 exloch, exhich = self.interpretExcludechan(ranges, ispw) 

1689 for i in range(len(exloch)): 

1690 N[:,exloch[i]:exhich[i],:].fill(1.0) 

1691 

1692 # ants and corrs to calculate: 

1693 (nCor,nCha,nAnt)=N.shape 

1694 

1695 # If we want renorm to resize segments on-the-fly due to possible issues with the  

1696 # boundary choice, we need to loop over each fitting and check. 

1697 if useDynamicSegments and (str(ispw) not in bwthreshspw.keys()): 

1698 # We may have to loop several times over our fitting process to ensure that we 

1699 # don't have a line that needs to be corrected falling on a segment boundary. 

1700 # Therefore, we set these to temporary values so we can adjust them freely. 

1701 nseg_tmp = nseg 

1702 dNchan_tmp = dNchan 

1703 

1704 i = 0 

1705 # We will only loop down to 1 segment. 

1706 while i <= floor(nseg/2): 

1707 if verbose: 

1708 casalog.post('\tAttempting fitting with nseg='+str(nseg_tmp)) 

1709 # N is edited in place by self.calcReNorm1() so we make a clean copy to play  

1710 # with while figuring out if the segmenting is working well. 

1711 N_tmp = N.copy() 

1712 if (self.corrATM and not skipAtmCorr) or (str(ispw) in excludechan.keys()): 

1713 N_atm_tmp = N_atm.copy() 

1714 # Initialize a redo variable for redoing the while loop 

1715 redo = False 

1716 # Loop over antennas, segments, and correlations 

1717 for iant in range(nAnt): 

1718 for iseg in range(nseg_tmp): 

1719 lochan=iseg*dNchan_tmp 

1720 hichan=(iseg+1)*dNchan_tmp 

1721 for icor in range(nCor): 

1722 # Edits N in place! just does the fit to get zero baseline.  

1723 # This is calcuating the ReNorm scaling per ant !!! 

1724 if checkLineForest and nseg_tmp>1: 

1725 redo = self.calcReNorm1( 

1726 N_tmp[icor,lochan:hichan,iant], 

1727 checkFit=True, 

1728 doplot=False, 

1729 iden='Ant'+str(iant)+'Seg'+str(iseg)+'Corr'+str(icor), 

1730 verbose=True 

1731 ) 

1732 else: 

1733 self.calcReNorm1( 

1734 N_tmp[icor,lochan:hichan,iant], 

1735 checkFit=False, 

1736 doplot=False, 

1737 iden='Ant'+str(iant)+'Seg'+str(iseg)+'Corr'+str(icor), 

1738 verbose=True 

1739 ) 

1740 

1741 # If we applied an ATM correction to the data, want to 

1742 # also see the non-ATM corrected data. 

1743 if (self.corrATM and not skipAtmCorr) or (str(ispw) in excludechan.keys()): 

1744 self.calcReNorm1( 

1745 N_atm_tmp[icor,lochan:hichan,iant], 

1746 checkFit=False, 

1747 doplot=False, 

1748 verbose=False 

1749 ) 

1750 if redo: 

1751 casalog.post(' Widening segment and retrying fit.') 

1752 break 

1753 if redo: 

1754 break 

1755 if redo: 

1756 break 

1757 if redo: 

1758 (nseg_tmp,dNchan_tmp) = self.calcChanRanges( 

1759 ispw, 

1760 bwthresh, 

1761 max(nseg_tmp-2,1), 

1762 edge=mededge, 

1763 verbose=verbose 

1764 ) 

1765 i += 1 

1766 continue 

1767 

1768 

1769 # Now check to see if any of the +/- 10 channels near the upper or 

1770 # lower segment edge are greater than 0.5% indicating an issue. If 

1771 # there is an issue, then reset and do the above again with 2 fewer 

1772 # segments 

1773 # 

1774 # Ignore the very edges, nothing we can do there anyway! 

1775 Nmed_tmp = np.nanmedian(N_tmp,axis=2) 

1776 for iseg in range(1,nseg_tmp): 

1777 seg_border=iseg*dNchan_tmp 

1778 # Want to check +/- 10 MHz on either side of the segment border 

1779 # or at least 10 channels. 

1780 limit = max(10, ceil(10.e6 / abs(self.msmeta.chanwidths(ispw)[0]))) 

1781 if nseg_tmp > 1: 

1782 trigger_floor = 1.005 

1783 if verbose: 

1784 casalog.post('\tChecking segment border at chan='+str(seg_border)) 

1785 if (Nmed_tmp[:,seg_border-limit:seg_border+limit] > trigger_floor).any(): 

1786 casalog.post('\tLarge scaling spectrum value (>' \ 

1787 + str(round((trigger_floor-1)*100,1)) \ 

1788 + '%) found at border, resizing segments and trying again.') 

1789 (nseg_tmp,dNchan_tmp) = self.calcChanRanges( 

1790 ispw, 

1791 bwthresh, 

1792 max(nseg_tmp-2,1), 

1793 edge=mededge, 

1794 verbose=verbose 

1795 ) 

1796 i += 1 

1797 redo=True 

1798 break 

1799 # Redo the fitting and such if we need to, otherwise, we're finished. 

1800 if redo: 

1801 continue 

1802 else: 

1803 if verbose: 

1804 casalog.post('\tCompleted fitting procedure with nseg='+str(nseg_tmp)) 

1805 break 

1806 

1807 # Make sure to set N and N_atm correctly as well as capture the  

1808 # final nseg and dNchan that was used. Note that this only keeps 

1809 # the very last nseg and dNchan that was used so if the final scan 

1810 # was different, it will not reflect the aggreagate choice, only 

1811 # the very last choice. 

1812 self.rnstats['inputs'][target][str(ispw)]['num_segments'].append(nseg_tmp) 

1813 self.rnstats['inputs'][target][str(ispw)]['dNchan'].append(dNchan_tmp) 

1814 N = N_tmp.copy() 

1815 if (self.corrATM and not skipAtmCorr) or (str(ispw) in excludechan.keys()): 

1816 N_atm = N_atm_tmp.copy() 

1817 

1818 # If we don't want to dynamically change the segment sizes or have specified one to  

1819 # use, just do it once and move on. 

1820 else: 

1821 self.rnstats['inputs'][target][str(ispw)]['num_segments'].append(nseg) 

1822 self.rnstats['inputs'][target][str(ispw)]['dNchan'].append(dNchan) 

1823 

1824 #If we are not using dynamic segments, then calculate what we have. 

1825 for iant in range(nAnt): 

1826 for iseg in range(nseg): 

1827 lochan=iseg*dNchan 

1828 hichan=(iseg+1)*dNchan 

1829 for icor in range(nCor): 

1830 # edits N in place! just does the fit to get zero baseline - this is calcuating the ReNorm scaling per ant !!! 

1831 self.calcReNorm1( 

1832 N[icor,lochan:hichan,iant], 

1833 doplot=False, 

1834 iden='Ant'+str(iant)+'Seg'+str(iseg)+'Corr'+str(icor) 

1835 ) 

1836 #N[icor,lochan:hichan,iant] = self.calcRenormLegendre(N[icor,lochan:hichan,iant]) 

1837 

1838 # If we applied an ATM correction to the data, want to 

1839 # also see the non-ATM corrected data. 

1840 if (self.corrATM and not skipAtmCorr) or (str(ispw) in excludechan.keys()): 

1841 self.calcReNorm1(N_atm[icor,lochan:hichan,iant],doplot=False) 

1842 

1843 ## LM added  

1844 if mededge: 

1845 # will set the 0.01 (1% - default) of all edge channels to the median value of the scaling spectrum (circa 1) 

1846 # stops high edge outliers 

1847 self.calcSetEdge(N, edge=mededge) 

1848 # If we applied an ATM correction to the data, want to 

1849 # also see the non-ATM corrected data. 

1850 if (self.corrATM and not skipAtmCorr) or (str(ispw) in excludechan.keys()): 

1851 self.calcSetEdge(N_atm, edge=mededge) 

1852 

1853 

1854 # LM added - excflagged 

1855 # regardless of any manually input excludeants we still check the cross-corr 

1856 # data for those antennas and simply see if it is entirely flagged 

1857 # i.e. 100% flagged antenna we set to 1.0 - i.e. no scaling 

1858 # thus plots are not skewed and anyway these antennas are not in the IF data 

1859 if excflagged: 

1860 # get the XC flags - if true returned its 100% flagged - deals with spw SPW, per scan basis as it is selected 

1861 antflagged = self.getXCflags(iscan,ispw,ifld,verbose=verbose) 

1862 # adds to excludeants list if its not already there 

1863 for excant in antflagged: 

1864 N[:,:,excant].fill(1.0) 

1865 # If we applied an ATM correction to the data, want to 

1866 # also see the non-ATM corrected data. 

1867 if (self.corrATM and not skipAtmCorr) or (str(ispw) in excludechan.keys()): 

1868 N_atm[:,:,excant].fill(1.0) 

1869 if verbose: 

1870 casalog.post('**** auto flagged antenna: '+self.AntName[excant]+' for SPW='+str(ispw)+', scan='+str(iscan)+', field='+str(ifld)+' ****') 

1871 

1872 if excludeants: 

1873 # we are excluding antennas all by index - converted above from names if input 

1874 # they should be set to 1.0 - this is a workaround to 

1875 # avoid bad antennas messing up the plots - if an analyst really needed 

1876 # to make a list of badantennas, and they were not flagged by pipeline 

1877 # then it is worrying why data are bad ... 

1878 for excant in excludeants: 

1879 N[:,:,excant].fill(1.0) 

1880 # If we applied an ATM correction to the data, want to 

1881 # also see the non-ATM corrected data. 

1882 if (self.corrATM and not skipAtmCorr) or (str(ispw) in excludechan.keys()): 

1883 N_atm[:,:,excant].fill(1.0) 

1884 

1885 

1886 # Check and fix outlier antennas compared to a representative median spectrum 

1887 if fixOutliers: 

1888 AntChk = self.checkOutlierAnt(N) 

1889 

1890 if len(AntChk) > 0: 

1891 # pass badant to the fix code for channel by channel investigation and correction 

1892 self.calcFixReNorm(N,AntChk,iscan,ispw,ifld,doplot=antHeuristicsSpectra,verbose=verbose) 

1893 # If we applied an ATM correction to the data, want to 

1894 # also see the non-ATM corrected data. 

1895 if (self.corrATM and not skipAtmCorr) or (str(ispw) in excludechan.keys()): 

1896 self.calcFixReNorm(N_atm,AntChk,iscan,ispw,ifld,doplot=antHeuristicsSpectra,verbose=verbose) 

1897 

1898 # No need to do any of this on the second round of data  

1899 if not second_pass: 

1900 # Need to calculate the maximum "N" value found, averaging over all antennas. 

1901 # We also need to exclude values of 1.0 if/where ants are flagged - otherwise  

1902 # the output will be skewed by those values and misrepresented. Here we use  

1903 # the found maximum when the max value != 1, otherwise we set it to a NaN and 

1904 # then calculate the mean ignoring NaN's.  

1905 Nmax = np.nanmean(np.where(N.max(axis=1)!=1, N.max(axis=1), np.nan), axis=1) 

1906 

1907 # If we wish to check for "false positives" where application of renormalization is 

1908 # falsely triggered by an ATM feature, then do the same calculation as above but 

1909 # only in the areas of the spectrum where ATM features are located. If there is a 

1910 # feature above the set "hardLim" (usually 2%) then renorm will get triggered for it 

1911 # or at least wrongly applied in that region.  

1912 #  

1913 # Also we want to keep track of the false positives if they occur (or not) using  

1914 # an attribute of the renorm object - self.atmWarning[target][spw] 

1915 if checkFalsePositives: 

1916 # Check and make sure there actually is an ATM line, otherwise ignore. 

1917 if atm_mask.any(): 

1918 # If we automatically excluded ATM lines then everything is set to 1.0 

1919 # in the range, therefore we need to check the N_atm array rather than 

1920 # the N array. 

1921 if atmAutoExclude: 

1922 Nmax_atm = np.nanmean( 

1923 np.where( 

1924 N_atm[:,atm_mask,:].max(axis=1) != 1, 

1925 N_atm[:,atm_mask,:].max(axis=1), 

1926 np.nan 

1927 ), 

1928 axis=1 

1929 ) 

1930 else: 

1931 Nmax_atm = np.nanmean( 

1932 np.where( 

1933 N[:,atm_mask,:].max(axis=1) != 1, 

1934 N[:,atm_mask,:].max(axis=1), 

1935 np.nan 

1936 ), 

1937 axis=1 

1938 ) 

1939 # Check to see if the atm region was blanked by other means (excludechan) 

1940 # such that the np.nanmean() of it will return NaN.  

1941 if sum(Nmax_atm) != sum(Nmax_atm): 

1942 self.atmWarning[str(fldname)][str(ispw)] = False 

1943 else: 

1944 if (Nmax_atm > hardLim).any(): 

1945 if atmAutoExclude: 

1946 if verbose: 

1947 casalog.post(' Significant atmospheric signal was removed by atmAutoExclude.') 

1948 else: 

1949 casalog.post(' WARNING! There may be significant artifical signal from an' \ 

1950 ' atmospheric feature that will trigger renorm application!!!') 

1951 self.atmWarning[str(fldname)][str(ispw)] = True 

1952 elif self.atmWarning[str(fldname)][str(ispw)]: 

1953 pass 

1954 else: 

1955 self.atmWarning[str(fldname)][str(ispw)] = False 

1956 else: 

1957 self.atmWarning[str(fldname)][str(ispw)] = False 

1958 

1959 if np.isnan(np.sum(Nmax)): 

1960 Nmax = np.array([1.0,1.0]) 

1961 Nmads = np.nanmedian(np.where(N!=1.0,np.absolute(N-1.0),np.nan),[1,2]) 

1962 if np.isnan(np.sum(Nmads)): 

1963 Nmads = np.array([0.0,0.0]) 

1964 scanNmax.append(np.mean(Nmax)) 

1965 alarm=' ' 

1966 if np.any(np.greater(Nmax,1.0+usefthresh)): 

1967 alarm='***' 

1968 if verbose: 

1969 casalog.post(' Mean peak renormalization factor (power) per polarization = '+str(alarm)+str(Nmax)) 

1970 casalog.post(' Median renormalization deviation (power) per polarization = '+' '+str(Nmads)) 

1971 

1972 # Diagnoastic plots - one level more detail vs. summary plots 

1973 # this is really the ant level what will be applied as a scaling 

1974 # 

1975 # skip these if second pass... 

1976 if diagSpectra: 

1977 if (self.corrATM and not skipAtmCorr) or (str(ispw) in excludechan.keys()): 

1978 self.plotdiagSpectra(N, iscan, ispw, ifld, plotATM=plotATM, N_atm=N_atm) 

1979 else: 

1980 self.plotdiagSpectra(N, iscan, ispw, ifld, plotATM=plotATM) 

1981 

1982 # In the spectra, antennas that have some scans as 1.0 due to being  

1983 # interferometrically flagged (or we excluded) we don't want them 

1984 # to skew the summary cumulative average plots using the rnstats 

1985 # if some scans are flagged and some are unflagged 

1986 if excflagged: 

1987 # regardless of flagged antennas or not we need to initiate the rnstats on the first scan 

1988 if ngoodscan==0: 

1989 self.rnstats['N'][target][str(ispw)]= N 

1990 if (self.corrATM and not skipAtmCorr) or (str(ispw) in excludechan.keys()):
