1991 self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)]= N_atm 

1992 ngoodscan+=1 

1993 elif antflagged and ngoodscan!=0: 

1994 # enter this loop if there ARE flagged antennas  

1995 for lpAnt in range(nAnt): 

1996 # if the antenna is not listed as flagged and the initiated first 

1997 # entry to rnstats['N'] is not 1.0 (i.e. flagged) we do 

1998 # the cumulative sum for the average spectra 

1999 if lpAnt not in antflagged and np.sum(self.rnstats['N'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt])/(2.*nCha)!=1.0: 

2000 self.rnstats['N'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt]=self.rnstats['N'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt]*ngoodscan/(ngoodscan+1) + N[:,:,lpAnt]/(ngoodscan+1) 

2001 # if the stored antenna scan value in rnstats is 1.0 (i.e. initiated with a flagged antenna 

2002 # but the antenna scan value we want to add now is good 

2003 # then just replace the rnstat antenna scaling values entirely 

2004 elif lpAnt not in antflagged and np.sum(self.rnstats['N'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt])/(2.*nCha)==1.0: 

2005 casalog.post('replacing scan with good for '+str(self.AntName[lpAnt])) 

2006 self.rnstats['N'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt]= N[:,:,lpAnt] 

2007 if (self.corrATM and not skipAtmCorr) or (str(ispw) in excludechan.keys()): 

2008 try: 

2009 if lpAnt not in antflagged and np.sum(self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt])/(2.*nCha)!=1.0: 

2010 self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt]=self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt]*ngoodscan/(ngoodscan+1) + N_atm[:,:,lpAnt]/(ngoodscan+1) 

2011 elif lpAnt not in antflagged and np.sum(self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt])/(2.*nCha)==1.0: 

2012 self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt]= N_atm[:,:,lpAnt] 

2013 # If we end up here, then the atmAutoExclude algorithm has only just  

2014 # started excluding scans. So we need to instantiate the N_atm dict 

2015 # with everything that is contained in N so far and then we can add 

2016 # the new data. 

2017 except KeyError: 

2018 self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)]=self.rnstats['N'][target][str(ispw)] 

2019 if lpAnt not in antflagged and np.sum(self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt])/(2.*nCha)!=1.0: 

2020 self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt]=self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt]*ngoodscan/(ngoodscan+1) + N_atm[:,:,lpAnt]/(ngoodscan+1) 

2021 elif lpAnt not in antflagged and np.sum(self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt])/(2.*nCha)==1.0: 

2022 self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt]= N_atm[:,:,lpAnt] 

2023 # remember to add to the scans assessed 

2024 ngoodscan+=1 

2025 else: 

2026 # if no flagged antennas were passed we do the default cumulative average as normal 

2027 self.rnstats['N'][target][str(ispw)]=self.rnstats['N'][target][str(ispw)]*ngoodscan/(ngoodscan+1) + N/(ngoodscan+1) 

2028 if (self.corrATM and not skipAtmCorr) or (str(ispw) in excludechan.keys()): 

2029 try: 

2030 self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)]=self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)]*ngoodscan/(ngoodscan+1) + N_atm/(ngoodscan+1) 

2031 # If we end up here, then the atmAutoExclude algorithm has only just  

2032 # started excluding scans. So we need to instantiate the N_atm dict 

2033 # with everything that is contained in N so far plus the new data. 

2034 except KeyError: 

2035 self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)]=self.rnstats['N'][target][str(ispw)]*ngoodscan/(ngoodscan+1) + N_atm/(ngoodscan+1) 

2036 ngoodscan+=1 

2037 ## Non flagged antenna cases 

2038 else: 

2039 # incrementally accumulate scan-mean spectra - keeps adding even as we do per field 

2040 self.rnstats['N'][target][str(ispw)]=self.rnstats['N'][target][str(ispw)]*ngoodscan/(ngoodscan+1) + N/(ngoodscan+1) 

2041 if (self.corrATM and not skipAtmCorr) or (str(ispw) in excludechan.keys()): 

2042 self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)]=self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(ispw)]*ngoodscan/(ngoodscan+1) + N_atm/(ngoodscan+1) 

2043 ngoodscan+=1 

2044 

2045 # PIPE 1168 (1) 

2046 # Repeat the same process but now we'll only be keeping normalized spectra that is above the threshold. 

2047 # This helps us plot mosaic sources and multi-target MSs as the mixture of empty/problem fields can wash the peaks. 

2048 if np.mean(Nmax) > hardLim: 

2049 if excflagged: 

2050 # regardless of flagged antennas or not we need to initiate the rnstats on the first scan 

2051 if ngoodscan_thresh==0: 

2052 self.rnstats['N_thresh'][target][str(ispw)]= N 

2053 ngoodscan_thresh+=1 

2054 elif antflagged and ngoodscan_thresh!=0: 

2055 # enter this loop if there ARE flagged antennas  

2056 for lpAnt in range(nAnt): 

2057 # if the antenna is not listed as flagged and the initiated first 

2058 # entry to rnstats['N_thresh'] is not 1.0 (i.e. flagged) we do 

2059 # the cumulative sum for the average spectra 

2060 if lpAnt not in antflagged and np.sum(self.rnstats['N_thresh'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt])/(2.*nCha)!=1.0: 

2061 self.rnstats['N_thresh'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt]=self.rnstats['N_thresh'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt]*ngoodscan_thresh/(ngoodscan_thresh+1) + N[:,:,lpAnt]/(ngoodscan_thresh+1) 

2062 # if the stored antenna scan value in rnstats is 1.0 (i.e. initiated with a flagged antenna 

2063 # but the antenna scan value we want to add now is good 

2064 # then just replace the rnstat antenna scaling values entirely 

2065 elif lpAnt not in antflagged and np.sum(self.rnstats['N_thresh'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt])/(2.*nCha)==1.0: 

2066 casalog.post('replacing scan with good for '+str(self.AntName[lpAnt])) 

2067 self.rnstats['N_thresh'][target][str(ispw)][:,:,lpAnt]= N[:,:,lpAnt] 

2068 # remember to add to the scans assessed 

2069 ngoodscan_thresh+=1 

2070 else: 

2071 # if no flagged antennas were passed we do the default cumulative average as normal 

2072 self.rnstats['N_thresh'][target][str(ispw)]=self.rnstats['N_thresh'][target][str(ispw)]*ngoodscan_thresh/(ngoodscan_thresh+1) + N/(ngoodscan_thresh+1) 

2073 ngoodscan_thresh+=1 

2074 

2075 ## Non flagged antenna cases 

2076 else: 

2077 # incrementally accumulate scan-mean spectra - keeps adding even as we do per field 

2078 self.rnstats['N_thresh'][target][str(ispw)]=self.rnstats['N_thresh'][target][str(ispw)]*ngoodscan_thresh/(ngoodscan_thresh+1) + N/(ngoodscan_thresh+1) 

2079 ngoodscan_thresh+=1 

2080 

2081 # below is George's original code and these are used in other RN.plot* (not the spectral one)  

2082 # this does not add per field, it appears that only the last field will be appended currently 

2083 # as it is not cumulative, it is a replacement that calls only ispw and iscan 

2084 # the current median will possibly be skewed by antennas set to 1.0 if flagged 

2085 # if the last field has no scaling, plots using these scan based stats/and latter plots 

2086 # will not show anything useful 

2087 self.rnstats['rNmax'][:,:,spws.index(ispw),targscans.index(iscan)]=N.max(1) 

2088 self.rnstats['rNmdev'][:,:,spws.index(ispw),targscans.index(iscan)]=np.median(np.absolute(N-1.0),1) 

2089 

2090 # write in the max value for this SPW, scan, field into the self.scalingValues dictionary 

2091 self.scalingValues[str(ispw)][str(iscan)][str(ifld)]=np.mean(Nmax) # average the correlations 

2092 

2093 # Need to move this part out of the docorr check so that we can add a check to above thresh, then add to  

2094 # to the dictionary. Then after each scan/field, we check for it to be above the limit and update it each 

2095 # time to set to True/False unless it is already set to True. Should do this regardless of the number of 

2096 # fields as it would catch single field targets that wobble around the limit.  

2097 # 

2098 # Check if above limit but only on the first pass through the data 

2099 if np.mean(Nmax) > hardLim: 

2100 # Nmax hold 2 values for dual corr (xx,yy) coming from mean of all maximal values of all ants  

2101 self.docorrApply[target][str(ispw)]=True # will correct this field 

2102 # if this field isn't above the limit but it's already True, pass 

2103 elif self.docorrApply[target][str(ispw)]: 

2104 pass 

2105 # if not above the limit and not already set to True, set to False 

2106 else: 

2107 self.docorrApply[target][str(ispw)]=False 

2108 

2109 # If we want to apply the correction and it's the second time through the data 

2110 if createCalTable and second_pass: 

2111 casalog.post(f'Writing solutions to table {self.rntable} for field {ifld} of scan {iscan}, spw {ispw}') 

2112 self.writeCalTable(ispw, ifld, iscan, N, rntb_iter) 

2113 rntb_iter += 1 

2114 # If renorm didn't trigger but we still need to fill in the cal table with filler values, 

2115 # then do that now. If renorm has triggered, then we can ignore this since we'll need to 

2116 # overwrite those values anyway. 

2117 if not self.docorrApply[target][str(ispw)]: 

2118 if createCalTable and not second_pass and fillTable: 

2119 casalog.post(f' Filling caltable {self.rntable} with value of 1.0 - renorm unnecessary for field {ifld} of scan {iscan}, spw {ispw}.') 

2120 N_fill = np.ones(N.shape) 

2121 self.writeCalTable(ispw, ifld, iscan, N_fill, rntb_iter) 

2122 rntb_iter += 1 

2123 else: 

2124 if createCalTable and not second_pass and fillTable: 

2125 casalog.post(' Renorm triggered, solutions will be re-written to table. Pausing filling of table...') 

2126 

2127 

2128 

2129 # closes the data check to see if the AC data is confirmed to be filled  

2130 # - only gets here if None was returned 

2131 else: 

2132 if verbose: 

2133 casalog.post(' **** No data found - skipping field '+str(ifld)+' in scan '+str(iscan)+' ****') 

2134 continue 

2135 

2136 if not second_pass: 

2137 # print per scan max val 

2138 if ifld == max(Tarfld): 

2139 casalog.post(' Max peak renormalization factor (power) over scan '+str(iscan)+' = '+str(max(scanNmax))) 

2140 

2141 # After doing the first pass, if createCalTable is True and docorrApply was set to True,  

2142 # we now need to go through again and actually apply the renormalization if it was necessary 

2143 if createCalTable and not second_pass and self.docorrApply[target][str(ispw)]: 

2144 second_pass_required = True 

2145 

2146 

2147 if checkFalsePositives: 

2148 exclude_cmd = self.suggestAtmExclude(target, str(ispw), return_command=True) 

2149 if self.atmWarning[str(fldname)][str(ispw)]: 

2150 if atmAutoExclude: 

2151 casalog.post('Atmospheric features above the threshold have been mitigated by atmAutoExclude.') 

2152 casalog.post('Equivalent manual call: '+exclude_cmd) 

2153 else: 

2154 casalog.post('ATM features may be falsely triggering renorm!') 

2155 casalog.post('Suggested channel exclusion: '+exclude_cmd) 

2156 elif exclude_cmd != "No flagging suggested.": 

2157 casalog.post('Atmospheric features mitigated.') 

2158 casalog.post('Equivalent manual call: '+exclude_cmd) 

2159 

2160 if createCalTable: 

2161 # If fillTable is selected as an option, then we need to also fill in  

2162 # all the science TDM windows as well (if any) for this target.  

2163 if len(self.tdmspws) > 0 and fillTable: 

2164 casalog.post(f'\nFilling in TDM spws in calibration table {self.rntable} with value of 1.0') 

2165 for ispw in self.tdmspws: 

2166 #casalog.post(f' Writing filler solutions for spw {ispw}') 

2167 # Not all targets are in all scans, we need to iterate over only those scans containing the target 

2168 target_scans = np.intersect1d(self.msmeta.scansforintent('*TARGET*'), self.msmeta.scansforfield(target)) 

2169 

2170 # Make an additional cut to catch only those scans which contain the current spw (usually only relevant 

2171 # for spectral scan datasets) 

2172 target_scans = np.intersect1d(target_scans, self.msmeta.scansforspw(ispw)) 

2173 

2174 # If user input list of scans to use, cross check those with the list of all scans on targets to make 

2175 # sure it's necessary to perform this loop.  

2176 target_scans = np.intersect1d(target_scans, targscans) 

2177 

2178 # global list of scans with the current spw 

2179 spwscans=list(self.msmeta.scansforspw(ispw)) 

2180 

2181 for iscan in target_scans: 

2182 #casalog.post(f' Scan {iscan}') 

2183 # get the fields to process in this scan - i.e. mosaics have many fields per scan 

2184 Tarfld = list(self.msmeta.fieldsforscan(iscan)) 

2185 

2186 for ifld in Tarfld: 

2187 # Skip over target scans that don't have the current spw - can happen for spectral scans? 

2188 if spwscans.count(iscan) == 0: 

2189 continue 

2190 casalog.post(f' Writing filler solutions for spw {ispw}, scan {iscan}, field {ifld}') 

2191 N_fill = np.ones((self.num_corrs, self.msmeta.nchan(ispw), self.nAnt)) 

2192 self.writeCalTable(ispw, ifld, iscan, N_fill, rntb_iter) 

2193 rntb_iter += 1 

2194 

2195 

2196 

2197 # PIPE 1168 (3) 

2198 # Loops through the scalingValue dict and populates the pipeline needed dictionary 

2199 self.rnpipestats = {} 

2200 target_field_ids = self.msmeta.fieldsforintent('*TARGET*') 

2201 target_fields = np.unique(self.msmeta.namesforfields(target_field_ids)) 

2202 for trg in self.rnstats['N'].keys(): #target_fields: 

2203 self.rnpipestats[trg] = {} 

2204 for spw in self.rnstats['N'][trg].keys(): # spws: 

2205 self.rnpipestats[trg][spw] = {} 

2206 scans = np.intersect1d(self.msmeta.scansforintent('*TARGET*'), self.msmeta.scansforfield(trg)) # find scans related to this target 

2207 scans = np.intersect1d(scans, self.msmeta.scansforspw(int(spw))) # find scans related to given spw (spectral scan) 

2208 scans = np.intersect1d(scans, targscans) # if user input scans, limit to those 

2209 pipe_target_sv, pipe_target_fld = [],[] 

2210 for scan in scans: 

2211 fields = np.intersect1d(self.msmeta.fieldsforintent('*TARGET*'), self.msmeta.fieldsforname(trg)) # fields for target 

2212 fields = np.intersect1d(fields, self.msmeta.fieldsforscan(scan)) # fields for given scan 

2213 for field in fields: 

2214 pipe_target_sv.append(self.scalingValues[str(spw)][str(scan)][str(field)]) 

2215 pipe_target_fld.append(field) 

2216 self.rnpipestats[trg][spw]['max_rn'] = max(pipe_target_sv) 

2217 self.rnpipestats[trg][spw]['max_rn_field'] = pipe_target_fld[np.where(np.array(pipe_target_sv) == self.rnpipestats[trg][spw]['max_rn'])[0][0]] 

2218 self.rnpipestats[trg][spw]['threshold'] = hardLim 

2219 if len(np.unique(self.rnstats['inputs'][trg][spw]['dNchan'])) > 1: 

2220 self.rnpipestats[trg][spw]['seg_change'] = True 

2221 else: 

2222 self.rnpipestats[trg][spw]['seg_change'] = False 

2223 

2224 # If we have been applying solutions, close the table as we finish. 

2225 if createCalTable: 

2226 self.rntb.close() 

2227 

2228 # final log end of the renormalize function 

2229 casalog.post('*** ALMA almarenorm.py ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

2230 casalog.post('*** '+str(self.RNversion)+' ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

2231 casalog.post('*** End of renormalization run ***', 'INFO', 'ReNormalize') 

2232 

2233 def fixCalTable(self, start, end): 

2234 """ 

2235 Purpose: 

2236 This function will be invoked when data wobble around the renorm  

2237 threshold value such that some scans do not trigger renorm while 

2238 some do. When fillTable is set to True, this causes there to be 

2239 some scans with all values set to 1.0 and others to have valid 

2240 entries. The renormalize() method will go back and rewrite those 

2241 rows but this messes up the caltable if the data are already  

2242 written. Therefore, this will delete the already added rows. 

2243  

2244 Inputs: 

2245 num_rows : int 

2246 The number of rows to delete. 

2247 

2248 Outputs: 

2249 None. The table is directly modified.  

2250 """ 

2251 rem_arr = np.arange(start, end) 

2252 self.rntb.removerows(rownrs=rem_arr) 

2253 

2254 def writeCalTable(self, spw, field, scan, N, iter_n): 

2255 """ 

2256 Purpose:  

2257 This function takes in a Renormalization Spectrum and writes that  

2258 solution to a calibration table. The table is essentially another 

2259 Tsys calibration table.  

2260 

2261 Inputs: 

2262 spw : integer 

2263 Spw that relates to the data. 

2264 

2265 field : integer  

2266 Field ID number that relates to the data. 

2267 

2268 scan : integer 

2269 Scan number that relates to the data. 

2270 

2271 N : np.array 

2272 A 3-D numpy array of shape  

2273  

2274 (number polarization : number channels : number antenna) 

2275 

2276 that contains the renormalization spectrum to be written to  

2277 the calibration table. 

2278  

2279 iter_n : integer 

2280 A book-keeping value that keeps track of how many times we  

2281 have written to the table to avoid over-writing data. 

2282 

2283 Output: 

2284 None, the calibration table initialized by self.renormalize() is 

2285 updated with the contents of input N and all related metadata. 

2286 """ 

2287 # We need the number of antennas from the array shape as this will be 

2288 # the number of rows we'll be adding to the table currently. 

2289 nPol, nChan, nAnt = N.shape 

2290 

2291 # For the single pol case, fill the other pol with ones so that the  

2292 # Pipeline can handle it.  

2293 if nPol == 1: 

2294 N_fill = np.ones(N.shape) 

2295 N = np.concatenate((N,N_fill)) 

2296 

2297 # Antenna based corrections so we need 1 row for each antenna 

2298 self.rntb.addrows(nrow = nAnt) 

2299 

2300 # Placing the renorm values themselves into the table 

2301 self.rntb.putcol('FPARAM', N, startrow=iter_n*nAnt, nrow=nAnt) 

2302 

2303 # Following the convention of the Tsys table, filling all values with 0.1 for the error. 

2304 self.rntb.putcol('PARAMERR', N*0.0+0.1, startrow=iter_n*nAnt, nrow=nAnt) 

2305 

2306 # Filling the flags with 0's since we don't really flag data here.  

2307 self.rntb.putcol('FLAG', N*0, startrow=iter_n*nAnt, nrow=nAnt) 

2308 

2309 # Filling the SNR and Weights with 1's, no real meaning for it here. 

2310 self.rntb.putcol('SNR', N/N, startrow=iter_n*nAnt, nrow=nAnt) 

2311 self.rntb.putcol('WEIGHT', N/N, startrow=iter_n*nAnt, nrow=nAnt) 

2312 

2313 # Using the mean time of the input scan 

2314 self.rntb.putcol('TIME', [np.mean(self.msmeta.timesforscan(scan))]*nAnt, startrow=iter_n*nAnt, nrow=nAnt) 

2315 

2316 # Given as input 

2317 self.rntb.putcol('FIELD_ID', [field]*nAnt, startrow=iter_n*nAnt, nrow=nAnt) 

2318 self.rntb.putcol('SCAN_NUMBER', [scan]*nAnt, startrow=iter_n*nAnt, nrow=nAnt) 

2319 self.rntb.putcol('SPECTRAL_WINDOW_ID', [spw]*nAnt, startrow=iter_n*nAnt, nrow=nAnt) 

2320 

2321 # Antenna 1 is equal to the row number we are in and Antenna 2 is meaningless since these 

2322 # are antenna based corrections.  

2323 self.rntb.putcol('ANTENNA1', np.arange(nAnt), startrow=iter_n*nAnt, nrow=nAnt) 

2324 self.rntb.putcol('ANTENNA2', [-1]*nAnt, startrow=iter_n*nAnt, nrow=nAnt) 

2325 

2326 # Interval has a meaning similar to the length of time a solution is valid for.  

2327 # Tsys tables use 0, we could use 0 or the length of this scan here since we are 

2328 # taking an average over the scan length.  

2329 self.rntb.putcol('INTERVAL', [0]*nAnt, startrow=iter_n*nAnt, nrow=nAnt) 

2330 

2331 # Not sure what this is... but it's 0 for Tsys tables 

2332 self.rntb.putcol('OBSERVATION_ID', [0]*nAnt, startrow=iter_n*nAnt, nrow=nAnt) 

2333 

2334 def calcChanRanges(self,spw,bwthresh=120e6,bwdiv='odd',onlyfdm=True, edge=0.01,verbose=False): 

2335 

2336 Tbw=self.msmeta.bandwidths(spw) 

2337 nchan=self.msmeta.nchan(spw) 

2338 

2339 nseg=1 

2340 dNchan=nchan 

2341 

2342 # Only do non-trivial segments if bwthresh exceeded AND spw is FDM  

2343 # (lots of channels). First check the number of channels explicitly.  

2344 # If we have a small number of channels, we don't want to divide up  

2345 # the spectrum into a ridiculous number of divisions and overfit. Less 

2346 # than 128, no need to divide the window up at all, from there scale  

2347 # up to a max of 7. 

2348 if nchan <= 128: 

2349 casalog.post(' **Small number of channels found, will not divide up the spw.') 

2350 if type(bwdiv) is int: 

2351 casalog.post(' Ignoring input bwdiv of '+str(bwdiv)+' since number of channels is already small.') 

2352 return (nseg,dNchan) 

2353 elif nchan <= 300: 

2354 max_divs = 3.0 

2355 elif nchan <= 550: 

2356 max_divs = 5.0 

2357 else: 

2358 max_divs = 7.0 

2359 # check first if we are forcing a divide 

2360 if type(bwdiv) is int and spw in self.fdmspws: 

2361 # make float so we can check dNchan 

2362 nseg=float(bwdiv) 

2363 dNchan=nchan/nseg 

2364 # check if nseg gives an integer nchans or if the remaining chans  

2365 # when dNchan is not an int will be covered by the edge boundaries 

2366 if dNchan.is_integer() or nchan%nseg < edge*nchan: 

2367 dNchan = int(dNchan) 

2368 nseg=int(nseg) 

2369 else: 

2370 casalog.post(" Input bwdiv (nseg) does not divide the SPW into an integer number of channels ") 

2371 casalog.post(" and the remaining channels are not excluded in the edges ") 

2372 casalog.post(" Will default to power of 2 division based on bwthresh ") 

2373 nseg=max(0,2**int(ceil(log(Tbw/bwthresh)/log(2)))) 

2374 dNchan=int(nchan/nseg) 

2375 # This is overkill given the above restrictions, limiting to 3, 5, or 7 

2376 # segments ensures that there are no answers for which the remainder  

2377 # does not fall into the edge channel rejection... 

2378 elif Tbw>bwthresh and spw in self.fdmspws: 

2379 if bwdiv=='odd': 

2380 # work out best odd divisibile when dNchan is an int need to 

2381 # avoid splitting up wide spws into too many slices which can 

2382 # cause major issues 

2383 nseg = min(max_divs, Tbw/bwthresh) 

2384 dNchan=nchan/nseg 

2385 

2386 # while condition is met when float value is equivalent to an  

2387 # int value (i.e. 7.0.is_integer() = True) 

2388 while not dNchan.is_integer(): 

2389 nseg=int(ceil(nseg)) 

2390 dNchan=nchan/nseg 

2391 # check if the new nseg is actually odd, otherwise make it odd 

2392 if nseg%2 != 1: 

2393 nseg=int(ceil(nseg))+1.0 

2394 dNchan=nchan/nseg 

2395 # check if the remainder for this odd nseg falls into the  

2396 # median set edges i.e don't need to worry if nchan/nseg  

2397 # is a true integer division  

2398 # e.g. 2048 into 5, dNchan is 409.6, so 5x409 segs and  

2399 # remaining is 3 chans, but edge chans are 20, so  

2400 # they are anyway set to to the median value (~1) 

2401 # and we can use nseg = 5 without worry  

2402 if nchan%nseg <= edge*nchan: 

2403 # round down to nearest int and exit the while statment  

2404 dNchan=float(int(dNchan)) 

2405 else: 

2406 # if remainder not in edges, add to nseg and continue  

2407 nseg=int(ceil(nseg))+1.0 

2408 

2409 # case where odd numbers just will not go into the channel  

2410 # number inc remainder accounting 

2411 if nseg > 50: 

2412 nseg=max(0,2**int(ceil(log(Tbw/bwthresh)/log(2)))) 

2413 break 

2414 

2415 nseg=int(ceil(nseg)) 

2416 dNchan=int(nchan/nseg) 

2417 

2418 else: 

2419 # George's base function 

2420 nseg=max(0,2**int(ceil(log(Tbw/bwthresh)/log(2)))) 

2421 dNchan=int(nchan/nseg) 

2422 

2423 casalog.post('\tDividing spw into '+str(nseg)+' segments of '+str(dNchan)+' channels each.') 

2424 

2425 return (nseg,dNchan) 

2426 

2427 

2428 def stats(self): 

2429 return self.rnstats 

2430 

2431 def merge_dicts(self, dict1, dict2): 

2432 """ 

2433 Purpose: 

2434 Given two dictionaries, merge them together such that common 

2435 keys do not get overwritten. The main purpose is for merging 

2436 user input excludechan ranges with ATM excludechan ranges. 

2437 

2438 Inputs: 

2439 dict1, dict2 : dictionaries 

2440 The two dictionaries to merge together. 

2441 

2442 Outputs: 

2443 The merged dictionary. 

2444 """ 

2445 dict3 = copy.deepcopy(dict1) 

2446 for key, value in dict2.items(): 

2447 if key not in dict3.keys(): 

2448 dict3[key] = value 

2449 else: 

2450 cval = dict3[key] 

2451 dict3[key] = cval+';'+value 

2452 return dict3 

2453 

2454 def interpretExcludechan(self, ranges, spw): 

2455 """ 

2456 Pupose:  

2457 As an option to the self.renormalize() method, a user may input  

2458 channel ranges to be excluded from the analysis via the excludechan  

2459 option. Additionally, if the atmAutoExclude option is enabled the  

2460 renormalize method will attempt to fix any atmospheric features  

2461 that it thinks to be problematic. Those channel ranges, either  

2462 input or generated, are added to a dictionary and then need to be  

2463 interpreted correctly for both the exclusion and later plotting.  

2464 

2465 Inputs:  

2466 ranges : list 

2467 This is a list of the different ranges within a single spectral 

2468 window that need to be excluded. The expected format is: 

2469  

2470 ["low_channel~high_channel"; "low_channel~high_channel"; ...] 

2471 

2472 spw : integer 

2473 This is the spectral window number. This is only needed if the 

2474 inputs of ranges are in frequency but must always be given. 

2475 

2476 Outputs:  

2477 starts : list 

2478 A list containing the starting channels for each range to be  

2479 excluded. 

2480 

2481 ends : list 

2482 A list containing the ending channels for each range to be  

2483 excluded. 

2484 """ 

2485 starts, ends = [], [] 

2486 for rng in ranges: 

2487 # If the range is given in GHz rather than channels, need to find the  

2488 # correct indicies for that frequency range. 

2489 if 'GHz' in rng: 

2490 exlofq, exhifq = rng.split('~') 

2491 if 'GHz' in exlofq: 

2492 exlofq = float(exlofq.split('GHz')[0]) 

2493 else: 

2494 exlofq = float(exlofq) 

2495 exloch = self.findNearest( 

2496 self.msmeta.chanfreqs(spw, 'GHz'), 

2497 exlofq, 

2498 index=True 

2499 ) 

2500 if 'GHz' in exhifq: 

2501 exhifq = float(exhifq.split('GHz')[0]) 

2502 else: 

2503 exhifq = float(exhifq) 

2504 exhich = self.findNearest( 

2505 self.msmeta.chanfreqs(spw, 'GHz'), 

2506 exhifq, 

2507 index=True 

2508 ) 

2509 else: 

2510 rng = rng.split('~') 

2511 exloch = int(rng[0]) 

2512 exhich = int(rng[1]) 

2513 # Protect from "backward" inputs.  

2514 if exloch > exhich: 

2515 tmp = exloch 

2516 exloch = exhich 

2517 exhich = tmp 

2518 starts.append(exloch) 

2519 ends.append(exhich) 

2520 return starts, ends 

2521 

2522 def fitAtmLines(self, ATMprof, spw, verbose=False): 

2523 """ 

2524 Purpose: 

2525 Given an atmospheric profile, find the features caused by water/ozone/etc  

2526 and fit a Lorentizian profile to it, returning the center and gamma scale. 

2527 

2528 Inputs: 

2529 ATMprof : numpy.ndarray 

2530 An atmospheric profile as returned by ATMtrans() 

2531 

2532 verbose : boolean : OPTIONAL 

2533 If True, then information about the fit will be printed to the terminal. 

2534 

2535 Outputs: 

2536 centers : list of floats 

2537 The center channel of found features.  

2538 

2539 scales : list of floats 

2540 The gamma scale factor of found features.  

2541 

2542 Note: 

2543 This utilizes the scipy package, specifically scipy.signal.find_peaks and 

2544 scipy.optimize.curve_fit.  

2545 """ 

2546 def get_atm_peaks(ATMprof): 

2547 """ 

2548 Purpose: Use scipy's peak finding algorithm to find ATM dips >1%. 

2549  

2550 Inputs:  

2551 ATMprof : array 

2552 An atmospheric profile which is simply a 1 dimensional array. 

2553 """ 

2554 normATM = -ATMprof+np.median(ATMprof) 

2555 peaks, _ = find_peaks(normATM, height=0.01) 

2556 return peaks 

2557 

2558 def lorentzian(x, x0, a, gam, off): 

2559 """ 

2560 Purpose: Standard definition of a Lorentizian to optimize. 

2561 

2562 Inputs: 

2563 x : array 

2564 The x data to fit to 

2565 x0 : float 

2566 The line center. 

2567 a : float 

2568 The amplitude of the feature. 

2569 gam : float 

2570 The width of the feature (2*gamma = FWHM). 

2571 off : float 

2572 The offset from 0. 

2573 """ 

2574 return a * gam**2 / (gam**2 + ( x - x0 )**2) + off 

2575 

2576 def get_gamma_bounds(center, width=50.): 

2577 """ 

2578 Purpose: Assuming that atmospheric features are typically about 50km/s 

2579 wide, return the frequency width for a given center frequency 

2580 using the standard radio convention for velocity width. 

2581 

2582 delta_V = delta_nu / nu_0 * c 

2583 Inputs: 

2584 center : float 

2585 Freqency location of the line center, nu_0 in the above equation. 

2586 

2587 width : float : OPTIONAL 

2588 The velocity width in km/s. 

2589 Default: 50. 

2590 """ 

2591 ckms = 299792.4580 

2592 return width*center/ckms 

2593 

2594 # Find atmospheric features in the profile 

2595 atm_feature_idxs = get_atm_peaks(ATMprof) 

2596 

2597 # Define our x and y data. 

2598 xData = np.arange(0,len(ATMprof)) 

2599 yData = ATMprof 

2600 

2601 # Loop over each feature, fitting a Lorentizian and reporting the fits. 

2602 centers, scales = [], [] 

2603 for i in range(len(atm_feature_idxs)): 

2604 x0_guess = atm_feature_idxs[i] 

2605 a_guess = yData[x0_guess] - max(yData) 

2606 gamma_guess = 1.0 

2607 off_guess = np.median(yData) 

2608 

2609 # center must be +/- 20 channels,  

2610 # amp must be between 0 and -1 (atm dips are always negative here) 

2611 # gamma must be between 1 channel and full spw width. 

2612 # offset is between 0 (no transmission at all) and 1 (no opacity issues). 

2613 x0_bounds = [x0_guess-20, x0_guess+20] 

2614 a_bounds = [-1, 0] 

2615 gamma_bounds = [ 

2616 1, 

2617 get_gamma_bounds(self.msmeta.chanfreqs(spw)[x0_guess])/abs(self.msmeta.chanwidths(spw)[0]) 

2618 ] 

2619 off_bounds = [0,1] 

2620 try: 

2621 popt, cov = curve_fit( 

2622 f=lorentzian, 

2623 xdata=xData, 

2624 ydata=yData, 

2625 p0=[x0_guess,a_guess,gamma_guess, off_guess], 

2626 bounds=( 

2627 [x0_bounds[0], a_bounds[0], gamma_bounds[0], off_bounds[0]], 

2628 [x0_bounds[1], a_bounds[1], gamma_bounds[1], off_bounds[1]] 

2629 ), 

2630 ) 

2631 centers.append(popt[0]) 

2632 scales.append(popt[2]) 

2633 if verbose: 

2634 casalog.post('Initial Guesses:') 

2635 casalog.post('\tx0 = '+str(x0_guess)) 

2636 casalog.post('\ta = '+str(a_guess)) 

2637 casalog.post('\tgamma = '+str(gamma_guess)) 

2638 casalog.post('\toffset = '+str(off_guess)) 

2639 casalog.post('') 

2640 casalog.post('Bounds:') 

2641 casalog.post('\tx0 : ['+str(x0_bounds[0])+', '+ str(x0_bounds[1])+']') 

2642 casalog.post('\ta : ['+str(a_bounds[0])+', '+str(a_bounds[1])+']') 

2643 casalog.post('\tgamma : ['+str(gamma_bounds[0])+', '+str(gamma_bounds[1])+']') 

2644 casalog.post('\toffset : ['+str(off_bounds[0])+', '+str(off_bounds[1])+']') 

2645 casalog.post('') 

2646 casalog.post('Best Fit from scipy.optimize.curve_fit:') 

2647 casalog.post('\tx0 = '+str(popt[0])) 

2648 casalog.post('\ta = '+str(popt[1])) 

2649 casalog.post('\tgamma = '+str(popt[2])) 

2650 casalog.post('\toffset = '+str(popt[3])) 

2651 casalog.post('') 

2652 casalog.post('\tcovariance matrix:') 

2653 casalog.post(str(cov)) 

2654 casalog.post('') 

2655 casalog.post('\t std_devs = '+str(np.sqrt(np.diag(cov)))) 

2656 except RuntimeError: 

2657 casalog.post('\tWARN: ATM fitting failed to converge in default number of iterations!') 

2658 casalog.post('\tWARN: Resorting to using best initial guesses for exclusion.') 

2659 

2660 centers.append(x0_guess) 

2661 scales.append(np.mean(gamma_guess)) 

2662 return centers, scales 

2663 

2664 

2665 

2666 

2667 def plotSpectra( 

2668 self, 

2669 plotATM=True, 

2670 titlein=None, 

2671 plotDivisions=True, 

2672 hardcopy=True, 

2673 createpdf=True, 

2674 includeSummary=True, 

2675 plotOriginal=True, 

2676 shadeAtm=True, 

2677 showExcluded=True): 

2678 """ 

2679 Purpose: 

2680 This function makes a summary plot of the renormalization spectrum  

2681 for every spectral window that has been evaluated for a  

2682 renormalization correction. The plots are a cumulative average over  

2683 all scans and fields for each antenna and correlation. For sources  

2684 that have multiple fields per scan (mosaics), only those fields  

2685 that exceed the threshold are shown in the plot. This also means  

2686 that even single pointings that oscillate around the threshold will  

2687 have only those scans that exceed the threshold included in the  

2688 summary plot created. Additionally, any antenna that were fully  

2689 flagged during calibration will have their renormalization values  

2690 set to 1.0. 

2691  

2692 Note that renormalization() must be run before this can be run. 

2693 

2694 Inputs: 

2695 plotATM : boolean : OPTIONAL 

2696 This is a boolean switch to include the ATM transmission curves 

2697 in the plots. The bandpass is used as the representative ATM  

2698 transmission curve. Note that in Bands 9 and 10, the image  

2699 sideband transmission curve is also shown as a black line.  

2700 Default: True 

2701 

2702 titlein: string: OPTIONAL 

2703 This allows one to introduce their own title text.  

2704 Default: None 

2705 

2706 plotDivisions: boolean: OPTIONAL 

2707 This is a boolean switch to include vertical lines at all  

2708 locations where the spectral window was broken up during the  

2709 calcReNorm() stage when the spectral window renormalization  

2710 spectrum was fit to flatten the spectrum.  

2711 Default: True 

2712 

2713 hardcopy : boolean : OPTIONAL 

2714 This is a boolean switch to create a hardcopy of the plot as a 

2715 PNG file. If this is set to False, the plots will be shown  

2716 interactively but not saved. 

2717 Default: True 

2718 

2719 createpdf : boolean : OPTIONAL 

2720 This is a boolean switch to create a PDF of the summary plot  

2721 using the convertPlotsToPDF() method. This will only trigger  

2722 if hardcopy is also set to True. 

2723 Default: True 

2724 

2725 includeSummary : boolean : OPTIONAL 

2726 This is a boolean switch to include the summary plot in the  

2727 created PDF. As such, this is only evaluated if both hardcopy  

2728 and createpdf are set to True. 

2729 Default: True 

2730 

2731 plotOriginal : boolean : OPTIONAL 

2732 This is a boolean switch to overplot the original data before  

2733 any ATM correction was performed.  

2734 Default: True 

2735 

2736 shadeAtm : boolean : OPTIONAL 

2737 If set to True, this will shade the region of the spectrum  

2738 influenced by atmospheric features. Features are found and  

2739 fitted if plotATM=True, otherwise this option has no effect. 

2740 Default: True 

2741 

2742 showExcluded : boolean : OPTIONAL 

2743 If set to True, then areas of the spectrum that have been  

2744 excluded via the excludechan option in renormalize() will  

2745 be shown.  

2746 Default: True 

2747 """ 

2748 # Check that renormalize() has been run 

2749 if len(self.rnstats) == 0: 

2750 casalog.post('Please run renormalize before plotting!') 

2751 return 

2752 

2753 # Grab all available targets.  

2754 target_list = self.rnstats['N'].keys() 

2755 

2756 # Loop over all targets and make a separate summary plot for each 

2757 for target in target_list: 

2758 # Check to make sure the dictionary is filled (i.e. this target  

2759 # was evaluated). 

2760 if not bool(self.rnstats['N'][target]): 

2761 continue 

2762 plt.ioff() 

2763 

2764 # Loop over all spws being processed to make a summary for each  

2765 # target/spw. Grab the spws that exist after running renormalize()  

2766 # (i.e. if someone chose to only run a few spws rather than all  

2767 # available, only those that were processed are grabbed). 

2768 doSpws = self.rnstats['N'][target].keys() 

2769 for spw in doSpws: 

2770 freqs = self.msmeta.chanfreqs(int(spw),'GHz') 

2771 

2772 # Not all targets are in all scans, we need to iterate over  

2773 # only those scans containing the target 

2774 target_scans = np.intersect1d( 

2775 self.msmeta.scansforintent('*TARGET*'), 

2776 self.msmeta.scansforfield(target) 

2777 ) 

2778 # Make an additional cut to catch only those scans which  

2779 # contain the current spw (usually only relevant for spectral  

2780 # scan datasets) 

2781 target_scans = np.intersect1d( 

2782 target_scans, 

2783 self.msmeta.scansforspw(int(spw)) 

2784 ) 

2785 # if the user specified scans during renormalize() then the  

2786 # full scan list might not be included 

2787 target_scans = np.intersect1d( 

2788 target_scans, 

2789 self.rnstats['scans'] 

2790 ) 

2791 nscans= len(target_scans) 

2792 

2793 # renormalize() will populate the N_thresh dictionary for each  

2794 # target/spw only if a target/spw/scan/field exceeds the  

2795 # threshold. This allows us to plot a summary that only has the  

2796 # fields that exceed the threshold shown which prevents the  

2797 # renormalization factor being washed out by fields with no  

2798 # emission. If no field exceeded the threshold then the  

2799 # dictionary is simply filled with zeros and we fall back to  

2800 # the total cumulative sum.  

2801 if np.sum(self.rnstats['N_thresh'][target][str(spw)]) == 0.0: 

2802 N=self.rnstats['N'][target][str(spw)] 

2803 else: 

2804 N=self.rnstats['N_thresh'][target][str(spw)] 

2805 # If this part is triggered then only some scans/fields  

2806 # triggered meaning that not all scans may be in the final  

2807 # plot. Therefore, properly display the number of averaged  

2808 # scans in the title. 

2809 nscans=0 

2810 for tscan in target_scans: 

2811 for fld in self.scalingValues[str(spw)][str(tscan)].keys(): 

2812 if self.scalingValues[str(spw)][str(tscan)][fld] > self.bandThresh[self.Band]: 

2813 nscans+=1 

2814 break 

2815 

2816 if plotOriginal: 

2817 # If the dictionary is zero length, then no atm  

2818 # corrections were performed and the "original" 

2819 # data is the data. 

2820 if len(self.rnstats['N_atm'][target]) == 0: 

2821 atmCorr=False 

2822 else: 

2823 # However, the first spw(s) may not necessarily be  

2824 # defined so we need to catch those cases.  

2825 try: 

2826 if len(self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(spw)]) > 0: 

2827 N_atm = self.rnstats['N_atm'][target][str(spw)] 

2828 atmCorr=True 

2829 else: 

2830 atmCorr=False 

2831 except KeyError: 

2832 atmCorr = False 

2833 

2834 (nCor,nCha,nAnt)=N.shape 

2835 

2836 # Initialize the figure 

2837 fig = plt.figure(figsize=(10,8)) 

2838 ax_rn = fig.add_subplot(111, frame_on=False) 

2839 ax_rn.set_ylabel('Renorm Scaling') 

2840 ax_rn.set_xlabel('Frequency (GHz) (TOPO)') 

2841 ax_rn.minorticks_on() 

2842 ax_rn.ticklabel_format(useOffset=False) 

2843 

2844 # Setup secondary x-axis to display channels 

2845 ax_rn1 = ax_rn.twiny() 

2846 ax_rn1.set_xlabel('Channel') 

2847 ax_rn1.minorticks_on() 

2848 

2849 

2850 # If user input a title, set it up, otherwise use default 

2851 if titlein: 

2852 plt.title( 

2853 str(titlein) + '\n' 

2854 + self.msname 

2855 + ' Nant='+str(self.nAnt) 

2856 + ' <Nscan='+str(nscans)+'> ', 

2857 {'fontsize': 'medium'} 

2858 ) 

2859 else: 

2860 ax_rn.set_title( 

2861 self.msname 

2862 + '\nTarget='+target 

2863 + ' Spw='+str(spw) 

2864 + ' Nant='+str(self.nAnt) 

2865 + ' <Nscan='+str(nscans)+'>', 

2866 {'fontsize': 'medium'} 

2867 ) 

2868 

2869 # If we want to plot the original spectrum before dealing  

2870 # with the ATM, find the mean of the spectrum with no atm  

2871 # corrections, ignoring any antennas that have had all their  

2872 # values set to 1.0 (due to flagging), then plot the mean. 

2873 if atmCorr: 

2874 try: 

2875 Nm_atm = np.nanmean(np.where(N_atm!=1, N_atm, np.nan), 2) 

2876 Nm_atm[:][np.isnan(Nm_atm[:])] = 1.0 

2877 style = ['k--','k--'] 

2878 for icor in range(nCor): 

2879 ax_rn.plot( 

2880 freqs, 

2881 Nm_atm[icor,:], 

2882 style[icor], 

2883 alpha=0.25, 

2884 lw=2, 

2885 zorder=11 

2886 ) 

2887 except: 

2888 casalog.post('ATM corrections were not properly stored, ' \ 

2889 +'cannot plot original spectrum!') 

2890 

2891 # For each antenna/correlation, plot the cummulative sum,  

2892 # making the correlations unique colors. 

2893 style = ['r:','b:'] 

2894 for iant in range(nAnt): 

2895 for icor in range(nCor): 

2896 ax_rn.plot(freqs, N[icor,:,iant],style[icor]) 

2897 

2898 # Find the mean of the spectrum over all antennas, ignoring  

2899 # any antennas that have had all their values set to 1.0  

2900 # (due to flagging). 

2901 Nm = np.nanmean(np.where(N!=1, N, np.nan), 2) 

2902 Nm[:][np.isnan(Nm[:])] = 1.0 

2903 

2904 # Plot the mean renormalization spectrum 

2905 style = ['r-', 'b-'] 

2906 for icor in range(nCor): 

2907 ax_rn.plot(freqs, Nm[icor,:], style[icor]) 

2908 

2909 # Find max over all ants then the mean of that, ignoring any  

2910 # flagged antenna. This matches the values calculated by  

2911 # renormalize(). Because of discrete sampling and noise, the  

2912 # max of the mean spectrum does not necessarily equal the mean  

2913 # value of the maxes from each antenna because some antenna may  

2914 # peak in different channels for lines that spread over multiple  

2915 # channels. 

2916 if nCor == 1: 

2917 Nxmax = np.nanmean( 

2918 np.where(N.max(1)!=1, N.max(1), np.nan),1 

2919 )[0] 

2920 Nymax = Nxmax 

2921 elif nCor == 2: 

2922 Nxmax, Nymax = np.nanmean( 

2923 np.where(N.max(1)!=1, N.max(1), np.nan),1 

2924 ) 

2925 

2926 # If the max in either correlation is above the alarm theshold  

2927 # (fthresh), then draw a line at that amplidude, centered in  

2928 # the plot.  

2929 if Nxmax >= (1.0+self.fthresh) or Nymax >= (1.0+self.fthresh): 

2930 fmin = 3./8.*max(freqs) + 5./8.*min(freqs) 

2931 fmax = 5./8.*max(freqs) + 3./8.*min(freqs) 

2932 ax_rn.plot([fmin,fmax],[Nxmax]*2,'r-') 

2933 ax_rn.text(fmin,Nxmax,'<X>='+str(round(Nxmax, 4)), 

2934 ha='right',va='center',color='r',size='x-small') 

2935 if nCor == 2: 

2936 ax_rn.plot([fmin,fmax],[Nymax]*2,'b-') 

2937 ax_rn.text(fmax,Nymax,'<Y>='+str(round(Nymax, 4)), 

2938 va='center',color='b',size='x-small') 

2939 

2940 # Grab the plot limits and set them for making it "look pretty" 

2941 lims = list(ax_rn.axis()) 

2942 lims[0]=min(freqs)*0.99999 

2943 lims[1]=max(freqs)*1.00001 

2944 lims[2]=min(0.999,lims[2]) 

2945 lims[3]=max(1.15*lims[3]-0.15*lims[2],1.02) 

2946 ax_rn.axis(lims) 

2947 

2948 # If True, then show a small yellow area indicating where the  

2949 # spectrum has been blanked. 

2950 if showExcluded: 

2951 # Check to make sure it is not an empty input 

2952 if self.rnstats['inputs']['excludechan']: 

2953 # Check to make sure this spw has anything input, then grab the  

2954 # range and plot it. 

2955 if str(spw) in self.rnstats['inputs']['excludechan'].keys(): 

2956 ranges = [ 

2957 rng.strip() 

2958 for rng in self.rnstats['inputs']['excludechan'][str(spw)].split(';') 

2959 ] 

2960 starts, ends = self.interpretExcludechan(ranges, int(spw)) 

2961 for i in range(len(starts)): 

2962 ax_rn.axvspan( 

2963 freqs[starts[i]], 

2964 freqs[ends[i]], 

2965 ymin=0.05, 

2966 ymax=0.06, 

2967 facecolor='yellow', 

2968 ec='black', 

2969 zorder=0 

2970 ) 

2971 

2972 # If True, draw thin, dotted lines at the locations where the  

2973 # renormalization spectrum was broken up during the fitting  

2974 # process. 

2975 # 

2976 # Since the number of divisions can change through renormalization 

2977 # the mode is chosen and an indicator is placed in the upper right 

2978 # if the number of segments changed. 

2979 if plotDivisions: 

2980 if self.rnpipestats[target][str(spw)]['seg_change']: 

2981 ax_rn.text(0.6, 0.93, "Segment sizes changed!", color='red', fontsize='18', transform=ax_rn.transAxes) 

2982 dNchan = max( 

2983 set( 

2984 self.rnstats['inputs'][target][str(spw)]['dNchan'] 

2985 ), 

2986 key=self.rnstats['inputs'][target][str(spw)]['dNchan'].count 

2987 ) 

2988 nseg = max( 

2989 set( 

2990 self.rnstats['inputs'][target][str(spw)]['num_segments'] 

2991 ), 

2992 key = self.rnstats['inputs'][target][str(spw)]['num_segments'].count 

2993 ) 

2994 else: 

2995 dNchan = self.rnstats['inputs'][target][str(spw)]['dNchan'][0] 

2996 nseg = self.rnstats['inputs'][target][str(spw)]['num_segments'][0] 

2997 if nseg > 1: 

2998 xlocs = [iseg*dNchan for iseg in range(1,nseg)] 

2999 ax_rn.vlines(freqs[xlocs], 0.5, 5, linestyles='dotted', 

3000 colors='grey', alpha=0.5, zorder=10) 

3001 

3002 # Set the channels labels in the correct direction since the 

3003 # LSB will have "backward" frequencies and here the  

3004 # frequencies are always shown low to high. 

3005 if freqs[0] > freqs[-1]: 

3006 ax_rn1.set_xlim(len(freqs),0) 

3007 else: 

3008 ax_rn1.set_xlim(0,len(freqs)) 

3009 

3010 # If option selected, add the atmospheric profile to the plots,  

3011 # using the bandpass as the profile.  

3012 if plotATM: 

3013 # Setup the axis to draw on, using the same frequency axis 

3014 ax_atm = ax_rn.twinx() 

3015 # Grab the bandpass scan and protect against multiple  

3016 # existing. Also protect from a missing bandpass scan by  

3017 # falling back to the phase calibrator if necessary. 

3018 Bscanatm = self.getBscan(int(spw), verbose=False) 

3019 if not Bscanatm: 

3020 Bscanatm = self.getPhscan(int(spw), verbose=False) 

3021 if type(Bscanatm) is list: 

3022 Bscanatm = Bscanatm[0] 

3023 # If renormalize(correctATM=True) was run, the ATM profile 

3024 # already exists in a dictionary so use it. Otherwise,  

3025 # grab a new one and make sure to also grab the image  

3026 # sideband ATM profile if needed. 

3027 if 'BandPass' not in self.atmtrans.keys(): 

3028 if self.Band in [9, 10]: 

3029 ATMprof, ATMprof_imageSB = self.ATMtrans( 

3030 Bscanatm, 

3031 int(spw), 

3032 verbose=False 

3033 ) 

3034 else: 

3035 ATMprof = self.ATMtrans( 

3036 Bscanatm, 

3037 int(spw), 

3038 verbose=False 

3039 ) 

3040 else: 

3041 # Currently, correctATM will not properly handle Bands  

3042 # 9 and 10 but eventually the image sideband will need  

3043 # to be added here. 

3044 ATMprof = self.atmtrans['BandPass'][str(spw)][str(Bscanatm)] 

3045 

3046 # Plot the ATM profile 

3047 ax_atm.plot( 

3048 freqs, 

3049 100*ATMprof, 

3050 c='m', 

3051 linestyle='-', 

3052 linewidth=2 

3053 ) 

3054 if self.Band in [9, 10]: 

3055 ax_atm.plot( 

3056 freqs, 

3057 100*ATMprof_imageSB, 

3058 c='k', 

3059 linestyle='-', 

3060 linewidth=2 

3061 ) 

3062 ax_atm.yaxis.tick_right() 

3063 if self.Band in [9, 10]: 

3064 peak = max(np.maximum(ATMprof, ATMprof_imageSB)*100.)+10 

3065 ax_atm.set_ylabel('ATM Transmission (%), Image Sideband') 

3066 else: 

3067 peak = max(ATMprof*100)+10 

3068 ax_atm.set_ylabel('ATM Transmission (%)') 

3069 ax_atm.yaxis.set_label_position('right') 

3070 

3071 # Enforce a range of 100 

3072 atm_ymax = peak 

3073 atm_ymin = peak-100 

3074 ax_atm.set_ylim(atm_ymin, atm_ymax) 

3075 

3076 # Make sure that we don't label values that are less  

3077 # than 0 since that has no physical meaning. 

3078 yvals = np.arange(round(atm_ymin), round(atm_ymax)) 

3079 yvals_mod = yvals%20 

3080 ylabels = yvals[list(np.where(yvals_mod==0)[0])] 

3081 ylabels_mask = ylabels >= 0 

3082 ax_atm.set_yticks(ylabels[ylabels_mask]) 

3083 ax_atm.set_yticklabels( 

3084 [ 

3085 str(int(ylbl)) 

3086 for ylbl in ylabels[ylabels_mask] 

3087 ] 

3088 ) 

3089 

3090 # Gather stats for pipeline development 

3091 if 'atmStats' not in self.rnstats.keys(): 

3092 self.rnstats['atmStats'] = {} 

3093 if target not in self.rnstats['atmStats'].keys(): 

3094 self.rnstats['atmStats'][target] = {} 

3095 

3096 # Find the index and frequency with the maximum renorm value 

3097 maxRnIdx = np.where(Nm[0] == max(Nm[0]))[0][0] 

3098 maxRnFreq = freqs[maxRnIdx] 

3099 

3100 # Find where the ATM lines are by fitting Lorentzian profiles 

3101 atm_centers, atm_gammas = self.fitAtmLines(ATMprof, int(spw)) 

3102 if self.Band in [9, 10]: 

3103 num_lines = len(atm_centers) 

3104 atm_centers_SB, atm_gammas_SB = self.fitAtmLines( 

3105 ATMprof_imageSB, 

3106 int(spw) 

3107 ) 

3108 atm_centers += atm_centers_SB 

3109 atm_gammas += atm_gammas_SB 

3110 

3111 # Report found lines, if any. 

3112 # PL requested that statistics of ATM lines be printed out  

3113 # with this function. 

3114 # 

3115 # Output is: 

3116 # 

3117 # UID, SPW, Freq @ max renrorm value, Max renorm value, Freq @ Atm line, renorm value @ Atm line 

3118 # 

3119 # If there are multiple atm features, then multiple lines  

3120 # are output 

3121 if len(atm_centers) == 0: 

3122 self.rnstats['atmStats'][target][str(spw)] = \ 

3123 ', '.join( 

3124 [ 

3125 self.msname, 

3126 str(spw), 

3127 str(maxRnFreq), 

3128 str(Nm[0][maxRnIdx]) 

3129 ] 

3130 ) 

3131 casalog.post('\n{0:^30}'.format('ASDM uid') 

3132 + '{0:^5}'.format('SPW') 

3133 + '{0:^12}'.format('Freq@R_max') 

3134 + '{0:^9}'.format('R_max') 

3135 ) 

3136 casalog.post(''.join( 

3137 [ 

3138 '{0:^30}'.format(self.msname), 

3139 '{0:^5}'.format(str(spw)), 

3140 '{0:^12}'.format(str(round(maxRnFreq,6))), 

3141 '{0:^9}'.format(str(round(Nm[0][maxRnIdx],5))) 

3142 ] 

3143 ) 

3144 ) 

3145 casalog.post('') 

3146 else: 

3147 casalog.post('\n{0:^30}'.format('ASDM uid') 

3148 + '{0:^5}'.format('SPW') 

3149 + '{0:^12}'.format('Freq@R_max') 

3150 + '{0:^9}'.format('R_max') 

3151 + '{0:^12}'.format('Freq@atm') 

3152 + '{0:^9}'.format('R_atm') 

3153 ) 

3154 for i in range(len(atm_centers)): 

3155 # Set the ATM profile we want to report which might  

3156 # vary for Bands 9 and 10 

3157 profile = ATMprof 

3158 if self.Band in [9,10]: 

3159 if i >= num_lines: 

3160 profile = ATMprof_imageSB 

3161 # A Lorentizian has a width of gamma (which is != a  

3162 # Gaussian sigma!) where 2*gamma is the FWHM. Here  

3163 # we go a bit further to capture most of the ATM  

3164 # feature that is above the noise. This is from my  

3165 # empirical estimates from datasets I've collected  

3166 # and seems to capture most of signal without  

3167 # catching real signal for cases where an ATM line  

3168 # is coincident (or nearly so) with a real line.  

3169 # 

3170 # PIPEREQ-228 - Need to protect instances where the 

3171 # fitted feature starts or ends outside the spw! 

3172 atm_start = min( 

3173 max( 

3174 0, 

3175 int(atm_centers[i]-1.3*atm_gammas[i]) 

3176 ), 

3177 len(profile)-1 

3178 ) 

3179 atm_end = max( 

3180 0, 

3181 min( 

3182 int(atm_centers[i]+1.3*atm_gammas[i]), 

3183 len(profile)-1 

3184 ) 

3185 ) 

3186 if atm_start == atm_end: 

3187 continue 

3188 

3189 # Draw a shaded region where the line is 

3190 if shadeAtm: 

3191 ax_atm.axvspan( 

3192 freqs[atm_start], 

3193 freqs[atm_end], 

3194 ymin=0, 

3195 ymax=10, 

3196 alpha=0.25, 

3197 facecolor='grey' 

3198 ) 

3199 

3200 # Report the stats 

3201 atm_min_idx = atm_start + np.where( 

3202 profile[atm_start:atm_end] == min(profile[atm_start:atm_end]) 

3203 )[0][0] 

3204 atm_dip_freq = freqs[atm_min_idx] 

3205 if str(spw) not in self.rnstats['atmStats'][target].keys(): 

3206 self.rnstats['atmStats'][target][str(spw)] = \ 

3207 ', '.join( 

3208 [ 

3209 self.msname, 

3210 str(spw), 

3211 str(maxRnFreq), 

3212 str(Nm[0][maxRnIdx]), 

3213 str(atm_dip_freq), 

3214 str(Nm[0][atm_min_idx]), 

3215 '\n' 

3216 ] 

3217 ) 

3218 else: 

3219 self.rnstats['atmStats'][target][str(spw)] += \ 

3220 ', '.join( 

3221 [ 

3222 self.msname, 

3223 str(spw), 

3224 str(maxRnFreq), 

3225 str(Nm[0][maxRnIdx]), 

3226 str(atm_dip_freq), 

3227 str(Nm[0][atm_min_idx]), 

3228 '\n' 

3229 ] 

3230 ) 

3231 

3232 casalog.post(''.join( 

3233 [ 

3234 '{0:^30}'.format(self.msname), 

3235 '{0:^5}'.format(str(spw)), 

3236 '{0:^12}'.format(str(round(maxRnFreq,6))), 

3237 '{0:^9}'.format(str(round(Nm[0][maxRnIdx],5))), 

3238 '{0:^12}'.format(str(round(atm_dip_freq,6))), 

3239 '{0:^9}'.format(str(round(Nm[0][atm_min_idx],5))) 

3240 ] 

3241 ) 

3242 ) 

3243 casalog.post('') 

3244 

3245 # If option is selected, save a hardcopy of the plots.  

3246 # Otherwise, produce interactive plot and wait for user  

3247 # input to go on to the next plot. 

3248 if hardcopy: 

3249 os.makedirs('RN_plots', exist_ok=True) 

3250 fname = self.msname \ 

3251 + '_'+target \ 

3252 + '_spw'+str(spw) \ 

3253 + '_ReNormSpectra.png' 

3254 casalog.post('Saving hardcopy plot: '+fname) 

3255 plt.savefig('./RN_plots/'+fname) 

3256 plt.close() 

3257 # Save the filename of the plot to the rnpipestats  

3258 # dictionary so Pipeline can easily reference it. 

3259 self.rnpipestats[target][str(spw)]['spec_plot'] = fname 

3260 if createpdf: 

3261 self.convertPlotsToPDF( 

3262 target, 

3263 int(spw), 

3264 include_summary=includeSummary, 

3265 verbose=False 

3266 ) 

3267 else: 

3268 plt.show() 

3269 # Python 2 vs. 3, raw_input() changed to input() 

3270 try: 

3271 raw_input( 

3272 'Please close plot and press ENTER to continue.' 

3273 ) 

3274 except NameError: 

3275 input('Please close plot and press ENTER to continue.')
